quote: Lord  till I reach that blissful shore  No privilege so dear shall be As thus my inmost soul to pour In prayer to thee.
author: Charlotte Elliott

quote: Revival fires flame where hearts are praying.
author: Dick Eastman

quote: If we could all hear one another's prayers  God might be relieved of some of his burden.
author: Ashleigh Brilliant

quote: What I dislike least in my former self are the moments of prayer.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Our rages  daughters of despair  creep and squirm like worms. Prayer is the only form of revolt which remains upright.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: Prayer reaches out in love to a dying world and says  "I care."
author: Dick Eastman

quote: To pray together  in whatever tongue or ritual  is the most tender brotherhood of hope and sympathy that man can contract in this life.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: The deepest wishes of the heart find expression in secret prayer.
author: George E. Rees

quote: We are never more like Christ than in prayers of intercession.
author: Austin Phelps

quote: The spirit of prayer is the fruit and token of the Spirit of adoption.
author: John Newton

quote: If we do not love one another  we certainly shall not have much power with God in prayer.
author: Dwight L. Moody

quote: Keep us  Lord  so awake in the duties of our calling that we may sleep in thy peace and wake in thy glory.
author: John Donne

quote: I find in the Psalms much the same range of mood and expression as I perceive within my own life of prayer.
author: Malcolm Boyd

quote: I am used to praying when I am alone  thank God. But when I come together with other people  when I need more than ever to pray  I still cannot get used to it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: I always love to begin a journey on Sundays  because I shall have the prayers of the church to preserve all that travel by land  or by water.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Nor it is an objection to say that we must understand a prayer if it is to have its true effect. That simply is not the case. Who understands the wisdom of a flower? Yet we can take pleasure in it.
author: Rudolph Steiner

quote: I would rather stand against the cannons of the wicked than against the prayers of the righteous.
author: Thomas Lye

quote: Restraining prayer  we cease to fight  Prayer keeps the Christian's armor bright  And Satan trembles when he sees The weakest saint upon his knees.
author: William Cowper

quote: God dwells where we let God in.
author: Menachem Mendel

quote: Courage is not afraid to weep  and she is not afraid to pray  even when she is not sure who she is praying to.
author: J. Ruth Gendler

quote: Saints of the early church reaped great harvests in the field of prayer and found the mercy seat to be a mine of untold treasures.
author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

quote: At church  with meek and unaffected grace  His looks adorn'd the venerable place  Truth from his lips prevail'd with double sway  And fools who came to scoff  remain'd to pray.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: In the calm of sweet communion Let thy daily work be done  In the peace of soul-outpouring Care be banished  patience won  And if earth with its enchantments Seek thy spirit to enthrall  Ere thou listen  ere thou answer  Turn to Jesus  tell Him all.
author: G. M. Taylor

quote: God warms his hands at man's heart when he prays.
author: John Masefield

quote: Turn your doubts to question  turn your question to prayers  turn your prayers to God.
author: Mark R. Litteton

quote: Prayer  like radium  is a luminous and self-generating form of energy.
author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

quote: Whatever you do in revenge against your brother will appear all at once in your heart at the time of payer.
author: The Desert Fathers

quote: Any concern too small to be turned into a prayer is too small to be made into a burden.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: Never say you will pray about a thing  pray about it.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: The granting of prayer  when offered in the name of Jesus  reveals the Father's love to him  and the honor which he has put upon him.
author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

quote: A prayer  in its simplest definition  is merely a wish turned heavenward.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: They never sought in vain that sought the Lord aright!
author: James Drummond Burns

quote: Prayer is not to be used as a confessional  to cancel sin. Such an error would impede true religion. Sin is forgiven only as it is destroyed by Christ - Truth and Light.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: You pray in your distress and in your need  would that you might pray also in the fullness of your joy and in your days of abundance.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: At church  with meek and unaffected grace  His looks adorn'd the venerable place  Truth from his lips prevailed with double sway  And fools  who came to scoff  remain'd to pray.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: He that will learn to pray  let him go to Sea.
author: George Edward Herbert

quote: O God  if in the day of battle I forget Thee  do not Thou forget me.
author: William King

quote: If I am right  Thy grace impart  Still in the right to stay  If I am wrong  O teach my heart To find that better way!
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Our Father  which art in heaven  Hallowed be thy Name. Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread. And forgive us our debts  as we forgive our debtors. And lead us not into temptation  but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom and the power and the glory  for ever. Amen.
author: Matthew

quote: God warms his hands at man's heart when he prays.
author: John Masefield

quote: Every one that asketh receiveth  and he that seeketh findeth.
author: Matthew

quote: Our prayers should be for blessings in general  for God knows best what is good for us.
author: Socrates

quote: Ask  and it shall be given you  seek and ye shall find  knock  and it shall be opened unto you.
author: Matthew

quote: Pray as if everything depended on God  and work as if everything depended upon man.
author: Francis Cardinal Spellman

quote: Give us the strength to encounter that which is to come  that we may be brave in peril  constant in tribulation  temperate in wrath  and in all changes of fortune  and down to the gates of death  loyal and loving one to anther.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: The Christian ministry is the worst of all trades  but the best of all professions.
author: John Newton

quote: Do as we say  and not as we do.
author: Giovanni Boccaccio

quote: I would have every minister of the gospel address his audience with the zeal of a friend  with the generous energy of a father  and with the exuberant affection of a mother.
author: Francois Fenelon

quote: The test of a preacher is that his congregation goes away saying  not What a lovely sermon  but  I will do something!
author: St. Francis de Sales

quote: But in his duty prompt at every call  He watch'd and wept  he pray'd and felt for all.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: Some plague the people with too long sermons  for the faculty of listening is a tender thing  and soon becomes weary and satiated.
author: Martin Luther

quote: I have taught you  my dear flock  for above thirty years how to live  and I will show you in a very short time how to die.
author: George Sandys

quote: The minister's brain is often die "poor-box" of the church.
author: Henry B. Whipple

quote: An antisemite is a person who hates Jews more than is absolutely necessary.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: I am 52 years of age. I am a bishop in the Anglican Church  and a few people might be constrained to say that I was reasonably responsible. In the land of my birth  I cannot vote.
author: Bishop Desmond Tutu

quote: I never believed in Santa Claus because I knew no white dude would come into my neighbourhood after dark.
author: Dick Gregory

quote: It is a great shock at the age of 5 or 6 to find that in a world of Gary Coopers you are the Indian.
author: James Baldwin

quote: Never try to reason the prejudice out of a man. It was not reasoned into him  and cannot be reasoned out.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Since my little daughter is only half Jewish  would it be alright if she went into the pool only up to her waist?
author: Groucho Marx

quote: There are only two ways to be quite unprejudiced and impartial. One is to be completely ignorant. The other is to be completely indifferent.
author: Charles Curtis

quote: Prejudice is the child of ignorance.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Passion and prejudice govern the world  only under the name of reason.
author: John Wesley

quote: How it infuriates a bigot  when he is forced to drag out his dark convictions!
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Everyone is a prisoner of his own experiences. No one can eliminate prejudices - just recognize them.
author: Edward R. Murrow

quote: Fortunately for serious minds  a bias recognized is a bias sterilized.
author: A. Eustace Haydon

quote: Without the aid of prejudice and custom  I should not be able to find my way across the room.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: One may no more live in the world without picking up the moral prejudices of the world than one will be able to go to hell without perspiring.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: We hate some persons because we do not know them  and will not know them because we hate them.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: The mind of a bigot is like the pupil of the eye  the more light you pour upon it  the more it will contract.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: It is not healthy when a nation lives within a nation  as coloured Americans are living inside America. A nation cannot live confident of its tomorrow if its refugees are among its own citizens.
author: Pearl Buck

quote: Of all the injuries inflicted by racism on people of colour  the most corrosive is the wound within  the internalized racism that leads some victims  at unspeakable cost to their own sense of self  to embrace the values of their oppressors.
author: H. Jack Geiger

quote: He hears but half who hears one party only.
author: Aeschylus

quote: A fox should not be of the jury at a goose's trial.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: He who never leaves his country is full of prejudices.
author: Carlo Goldoni

quote: Prejudice is the child of ignorance.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Opinions founded on prejudice are always sustained with the greatest violence.
author: Lord Francis Jeffrey

quote: To lead an untrained people to war is to throw them away.
author: Confucius

quote: In fair weather prepare for foul.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: We should lay up in peace what we shall need in war.
author: Syrus

quote: To be prepared for war is one of the most effectual means of preserving peace.
author: George Washington

quote: If you are as happy  my dear sir  on entering this house as I am in leaving it and returning home  you are the happiest man in this country.
author: George Buchanan

quote: I would rather be right than President.
author: Henry Clay

quote: No man will ever bring out of the Presidency the reputation which carries him into it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: If forced to choose between the penitentiary and the White House for four years  I would say the penitentiary  thank you.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: They pick a President and then for four years they pick on him.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: My movements to the chair of government will be accompanied by feelings not unlike those of a culprit who is going to the place of his execution.
author: George Washington

quote: Congress shall make no law abridging the freedom of speech or of the press.
author: Constitution of the United States

quote: Our liberty depends on the freedom of the press  and that cannot be limited without being lost.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The freedom of the press is one of the great bulwarks of liberty and can never be restrained but by despotic governments.
author: George Mason

quote: Freedom of conscience  of education  of speech  of assembly are among the very fundamentals of democracy and all of them would be nullified should freedom of the press ever be successfully challenged.
author: F. D. Roosevelt

quote: Freedom of the press is the staff of life  for any vital democracy.
author: Wendell L. Willkie

quote: You must stir it and stump it  and blow your own trumpet  or trust me  you haven't a chance.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: The truly proud man is satisfied with his own good opinion  and does not seek to make converts to it.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Pride is the mask of one's own faults.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: Pride is the direct appreciation of oneself.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: There is a certain noble pride  through which merits shine brighter than through modesty.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: The sun will set without thy assistance.
author: The Talmud

quote: When a proud man hears another praised  he feels himself injured.
author: English proverb

quote: A confessional passage has probably never been written that didn't stink a little bit of the writer's pride in having given up his pride.
author: J. D. Salinger

quote: I do not believe that any peacock envies another peacock his tail  because every peacock is persuaded that his own tail is the finest in the world. The consequence of this is that peacocks are peaceable birds.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Pride  perceiving humility honourable  often borrows her cloak.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: There is a paradox in pride: it makes some men ridiculous  but prevents others from becoming so.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Pride had rather go out of the way than go behind.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: They are proud in humility  proud in that they are not proud.
author: Henry Burton

quote: Pride that dines on vanity  sups on contempt.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The proud hate pride - in others.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Oh! Why should the spirit of mortal be proud? Like a swift-fleeing meteor  a fast flying cloud  A flash of the lightning  a break of the wave  Man passes from life to his rest in the grave.
author: William Knox

quote: Pride and weakness are Siamese twins.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: In pride  in reas'ning pride  our error lies  All quit their sphere and rush into the skies. Pride still is aiming at the bless'd abodes  Men would be angels  angels would be gods.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The infinitely little have pride infinitely great.
author: Voltaire

quote: Principles become modified in practise by facts.
author: James Fenimore Cooper

quote: If principle is good for anything  it is worth living up to.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Important principles may and must be flexible.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Stone walls do not a prison make  Nor iron bars a cage  Minds innocent and quiet take That for an hermitage.
author: Richard Lovelace

quote: In durance vile here must I wake and weep  And all my frowsy couch in sorrow steep.
author: James Drummond Burns

quote: None of us can be free of conflict and woe. Even the greatest men have had to accept disappointments as their daily bread.
author: Bernard M. Baruch

quote: There is no man in any rank who is always at liberty to act as he would incline. In some quarter or other he is limited by circumstances.
author: Bonnie Blair

quote: Life has no smooth road for any of us  and in the bracing atmosphere of a high aim the very roughness stimulates the climber to steadier steps till the legend  "over steep ways to the stars " fulfills itself.
author: W. C. Doane

quote: When life's problems seem overwhelming  look around and see what other people are coping with. You may consider yourself fortunate.
author: Ann Landers

quote: If all our misfortunes were laid in one common heap  whence everyone must take an equal portion  most people would be content to take their own and depart.
author: Socrates

quote: A problem well stated is a problem half solved.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quote: It isn't that they can't see the solution  it's that they can't see the problem.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: If we can really understand the problem  the answer will come out of it  because the answer is not separate from the problem.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: The man who most vividly realizes a difficulty is the man most likely to overcome it.
author: Joseph Farrell

quote: A good problem statement often includes: (a) what is known  (b) what is unknown  and (c) what is sought.
author: Edward Hodnett

quote: Every path has its puddle.
author: English proverb

quote: You often get a better hold upon a problem by going away from it for a time and dismissing it from your mind altogether.
author: Dr. Frank Crane

quote: What one decides to do in crisis depends on one's philosophy of life  and that philosophy cannot be changed by an incident. If one hasn't any philosophy in crises  others make the decision.
author: Jeannette Rankin

quote: When I feel difficulty coming on  I switch to another book I'm writing. When I get back to the problem  my unconscious has solved it.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: You can surmount the obstacles in your path if you are determined  courageous and hard-working. Never be fainthearted. Be resolute  but never bitter.... Permit no one to dissuade you from pursuing the goals you set for yourselves. Do not fear to pioneer  to venture down new paths of endeavor.
author: Ralph J. Bunche

quote: Any concern too small to be turned into a prayer is too small to be made into a burden.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: When you approach a problem  strip yourself of preconceived opinions and prejudice  assemble and learn the facts of the situation  make the decision which seems to you to be the most honest  and then stick to it.
author: Chester Bowles

quote: The art of living lies less in eliminating our troubles than in growing with them.
author: Bernard M. Baruch

quote: No matter how big and tough a problem may be  get rid of confusion by taking one little step towards solution. Do something. Then try again. At the worst  so long as you don't do it the same way twice  you will eventually use up all the wrong ways of doing it and thus the next try will be the right one.
author: George F. Nordenholt

quote: The greatest and most important problems of life are all in a certain sense insoluble. They can never be solved  but only outgrown.
author: Carl Jung

quote: You can overcome anything if you don't bellyache.
author: Bernard M. Baruch

quote: There is no other solution to a man's problems but the day's honest work  the day's honest decisions  the day's generous utterance  and the day's good deed.
author: Clare Boothe Luce

quote: Every problem contains the seeds of its own solution.
author: Stanley Arnold

quote: When you can't solve the problem  manage it.
author: Dr. Robert H. Schuller

quote: The block of granite  which was an obstacle in the path of the weak  becomes a stepping stone in the path of the strong.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Real difficulties can be overcome  it is only the imaginary ones that are unconquerable.
author: Theodore N. Vail

quote: Many a man curses the rain that falls upon his head  and knows not that it brings abundance to drive away hunger.
author: Saint Basil

quote: Times of general calamity and confusion have ever been productive of the greatest minds. The purest ore is produced from the hottest furnace  and the brightest thunderbolt is elicited from the darkest storms.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: What is difficulty? Only a word indicating the degree of strength requisite for accomplishing particular objects  a mere notice of the necessity for exertion ... a mere stimulus to men.
author: Samuel Warren

quote: Problems are only opportunities in work clothes.
author: Henry J. Kaiser

quote: We must look for the opportunity in every difficulty  instead of being paralyzed at the thought of the difficulty in every opportunity.
author: Walter E. Cole

quote: I wish I were with some of the wild people that run in the woods  and know nothing about accomplishments!
author: Joanna Baillie

quote: I used to believe that marriage would diminish me  reduce my options. That you had to be someone less to live with someone else when  of course  you have to be someone more.
author: Candice Bergen

quote: The human mind prefers to be spoonfed with the thoughts of others  but deprived of such nourishment it will  reluctantly  begin to think for itself- and such thinking  remember  is original thinking and may have valuable results.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: I'll have to  as you say  take a stand  do something toward shaking up that system. ... Despair ... is too easy an out.
author: Paule Marshall

quote: Half the unhappiness in life comes from people being afraid to go straight at things.
author: William J. Lock

quote: All work of man is as the swimmer's: a vast ocean threatens to devour him  if he front it not bravely  it will keep its word.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Hiding leads nowhere except to more hiding.
author: Margaret A. Robinson

quote: There is no movement without our own resistance.
author: Dr. Laura Schlessinger

quote: All problems become smaller if you don't dodge them  but confront them.
author: William F. Halsey

quote: A great man is one who seizes the vital issue in a complex question  what we might call the jugular vein of the whole organism  and spends his energies upon that.
author: Joseph Rickaby

quote: Fear not those who argue but those who dodge.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: If the first woman God ever made was strong enough to turn the world upside down  these women together ought to be able to turn it right side up again.
author: Sojourner Truth

quote: It is a fact of history that those who seek to withdraw from its great experiments usually end up being overwhelmed by them.
author: Barbara Ward

quote: Only one feat is possible: not to have run away.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: We must prepare and study truth under every aspect  endeavoring to ignore nothing  if we do not wish to fall into the abyss of the unknown when the hour shall strike.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: We only really face up to ourselves when we are afraid.
author: Thomas Bernhard

quote: Life is the acceptance of responsibilities or their evasion  it is a business of meeting obligations or avoiding them. To every man the choice is continually being offered  and by the manner of his choosing you may fairly measure him.
author: Ben Ames Williams

quote: The superior man makes the difficulty to be overcome his first interest  success comes only later.
author: Confucius

quote: No man will succeed unless he is ready to face and overcome difficulties and is prepared to assume responsibilities.
author: William J. H. Boetcker

quote: The harder the conflict  the more glorious the triumph. What we obtain too cheap  we esteem too lightly  'tis dearness only that gives everything it's value.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: The greater the difficulty  the more glory in surmounting it.
author: Epicurus

quote: Can it be that man is essentially a being who loves to conquer difficulties  a creature whose function is to solve problems?
author: Gorham Munson

quote: Conquering any difficulty always gives one a secret joy  for it means pushing back a boundary-line and adding to one's liberty.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: To overcome difficulties is to experience the full delight of existence.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles he has overcome trying to succeed.
author: Booker T. Washington

quote: Happiness is the overcoming of not unknown obstacles toward a known goal.
author: L. Ron Hubbard

quote: Too bad all the people who know how to run the country are busy driving taxicabs and cutting hair.
author: George Burns

quote: Every morning I get up and look through the Forbes list of the richest people in America. If I'm not there  I go to work.
author: Robert Orben

quote: Managing is getting paid for home runs someone else hits.
author: Casey Stengel

quote: Most of the men sitting in first class on an airplane have really boring jobs.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: My brother-in-law had to give up his last job because of illness. His boss became sick of him.
author: Henny Youngman

quote: Vice president: That's the title given to a corporate manager instead of a raise.
author: James Humes

quote: One of the symptoms of an approaching nervous breakdown is the belief that one's work is very important.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: It's amazing how important your job is when you want the day off - and how unimportant it is when you want a raise.
author: Robert Orben

quote: People who work sitting down get paid more than people who work standing up.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: The profession of book writing makes horse racing seem like a solid  stable business.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: I'm a writer. I write checks. They're not very good.
author: Wendy Liebman

quote: It took me fifteen years to discover I had no talent for writing  but I couldn't give it up because by that time I was too famous.
author: Robert Benchley

quote: Ask a writer what he thinks about critics and the answer you get is similar to what you get when you ask a lamppost how he feels about dogs.
author: Bert Sugar

quote: America has not always been kind to its artists and scholars. Somehow the scientists always seem to get the penthouse while the arts and humanities get the basement.
author: Lyndon Johnson

quote: Few great men could pass personnel.
author: Paul Goodman

quote: She used to be a schoolteacher but she has no class now.
author: Fred Allen

quote: A celebrity is one who is known to many persons he is glad he doesn't know.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: An actor's a guy who  if you ain't talking about him  ain't listening.
author: Marlon Brando

quote: The celebrity is a person who is known for his well-knownness.
author: Daniel Boorstin

quote: By working faithfully eight hours a day  you may eventually get to be a boss and work twelve hours a day.
author: Robert Frost

quote: I once worked as a salesman and was very independent. I took orders from no one.
author: Gerald Barzan

quote: I'm a concert pianist. That's a pretentious way of saying I'm unemployed at the moment.
author: Oscar Levant

quote: If law school is so hard to get through  how come there are so many lawyers?
author: Calvin Trillin

quote: When asked to contribute ten dollars to a lawyer's funeral  I said: "Here's fifty. Bury five of them."
author: Melvin Helitzer

quote: I don't like the fact that doctors are referred to as practicing.
author: Janet Schwartz

quote: A male gynecologist is like an auto mechanic who has never owned a car.
author: Carrie Snow

quote: I hate being placed on committees. They are always having meetings at which half are absent and the rest late.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: My agent gets 10 percent of everything I get  except the blinding headaches.
author: Fred Allen

quote: He that will not apply new remedies must expect new evils  for time is the greatest innovator.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: If it is to be  It is up to me.
author: William H. Johnson

quote: All that is human must retrograde if it does not advance.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: Ambition can creep as well as soar.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: New roads  new ruts.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Progress  far from consisting in change  depends on retentiveness. Those who cannot remember the past are content to repeat it.
author: George Santayana

quote: The new electronic interdependence recreates the world in the image of a global village.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: All progress is based upon the universal innate desire on the part of every organism to live beyond its income.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: This world of ours is a new world  in which the unit of knowledge  the nature of human communities  the order of society  the order of ideas  the very notions of society and culture have changed  and will not return to what they have been in the past. What is new is new  not because it has never been there before  but because it has changed in quality.
author: J. Robert Oppenheimer

quote: And from the discontent of man The world's best progress springs.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: Every gain made by individuals or society is almost instantly taken for granted.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the men of old  seek what they sought.
author: Matsuo Basho

quote: Once you sink that first stake  they'll never make you pull it up.
author: Robert Moses

quote: Flight is the only true sensation that men have achieved in modern history.
author: James Dickey

quote: The fundamental magic of flying is a miracle that has nothing to do with any of its practical purposes - purposes of speed  accessibility and convenience - and will not change as they change.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: The really great visual experience today is to fly over a huge city and look down into the night. It's like a tremendous jubilant Christmas tree. You just feel life is worth living - when you come down you may have some doubts.
author: Gyorgy Kepes

quote: The century on which we are entering can be and must be the century of the common man.
author: Henry A. Wallace

quote: To spur a willing horse.
author: Latin proverb

quote: Removing the faults in a stage-coach may produce a perfect stage-coach  but it is unlikely to produce the first motor car.
author: Edward de Bono

quote: Progress might have been all right once  but it's gone on too long.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: Is it progress if a cannibal uses knife and fork?
author: Stanislaw Lee

quote: A thousand things advance  nine hundred and ninety-nine retreat  that is progress.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: The simple faith in progress is not a conviction belonging to strength  but one belonging to acquiescence and hence to weakness.
author: Norbert Wiener

quote: The major advances in civilization are processes which all but wreck the societies in which they occur.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Behold the turtle. He makes progress only when he sticks his neck out.
author: James Bryant Conant

quote: Always remember that the soundest way to progress in any organization is to help the man ahead of you to get promoted.
author: L. S. Hamaker

quote: What saves a man is to take a step. Then another step. It is always the same step  but you have to take it.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Daring ideas are like chessmen moved forward. They may be beaten  but they may start a winning game.
author: Goethe

quote: The rule is jam tomorrow and jam yesterday - but never jam today.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: The art of progress is to preserve order amid change  and to preserve change amid order.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Now here  you see  it takes all the running you can do to keep in the same place. If you want to get somewhere else  you must run at least twice as fast as that!
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: It so happens that the world is undergoing a transformation to which no change that has yet occurred can be compared  either in scope or in rapidity.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: If Jesus Christ were to come today  people would not even crucify him. They would ask him to dinner  and hear what he had to say  and make fun of him.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Man is flying too fast for a world that is round. Soon he will catch up with himself in a great rear-end collision and Man will never know that what hit him from behind was Man.
author: James Thurber

quote: Every step of progress the world has made has been from scaffold to scaffold  and from stake to stake.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: Today every invention is received with a cry of triumph which soon turns into a cry of fear.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: Once a man would spend a week patiently waiting if he missed a stage coach  but now he rages if he misses the first section of a revolving door.
author: Simeon Strunsky

quote: There is no royal road to anything. One thing at a time  and all things in succession. That which grows slowly endures.
author: J. G. Holland

quote: Growth for the sake of growth is the ideology of the cancer cell.
author: Edward Abbey

quote: The world owes all its onward impulses to men ill at ease. The happy man inevitably confines himself within ancient limits.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: That which comes into the world to disturb nothing deserves neither respect nor patience.
author: Rene Char

quote: Occasionally we sigh for an earlier day when we could just look at the stars without worrying whether they were theirs or ours.
author: Bill Vaughan

quote: What we call progress is the exchange of one Nuisance for another Nuisance.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: Every step of progress which the world has made has been from scaffold to scaffold  and from stake to stake.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: So long as all the increased wealth which modern progress brings  goes but to build up great fortunes  to increase luxury  and make sharper the contest between the House of Have and the House of Want  progress is not real and cannot be permanent.
author: Henry George

quote: Progress - the stride of God!
author: Victor Hugo

quote: If you strike a thorn or rose  Keep a-goin! If it hails or if it snows  Keep a-goin! 'Tain't no use to sit and whine 'Cause the fish ain't on your line  Bait your hook an' keep on tryin'. Keep a-goin!
author: Frank L. Stanton

quote: An acre of performance is worth the whole world of promise.
author: James Howell

quote: He who is the most slow in making a promise is the most faithful in the performance of it.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: Promise and pie-crust are made to be broken.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Undertake not what you cannot perform but be careful to keep your promise.
author: George Washington

quote: The quest for certainty blocks the search for meaning. Uncertainty is the very condition to impel man to unfold his powers.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Statistics are no substitute for judgement.
author: Henry Clay

quote: 'For example' is not proof.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: A half truth  like half a brick  is always more forcible as an argument than a whole one. It carries better.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: You are all you will ever have for certain .
author: June Havoc

quote: Doubt is not a pleasant condition  but certainty is.
author: Voltaire

quote: To believe with certainty we must begin with doubting.
author: Stanislaus, King of Poland

quote: What men want is not knowledge  but certainty.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The burden of proof lies on the plaintiff.
author: Legal maxim

quote: You cannot demonstrate an emotion or prove an aspiration.
author: John Morley

quote: I come from a State that raises corn and cotton and cock-leburs and Democrats  and frothy eloquence neither convinces nor satisfies me. I am from Missouri. You have got to show me.
author: Willard D. Vandiver

quote: Mine is better than ours.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: There can be to the ownership of anything no rightful title which is not derived from the title of the producer and does not rest upon the natural right of the man to himself.
author: Henry George

quote: The instinct of ownership is fundamental in man's nature.
author: William James

quote: The reason why men enter into society is the preservation of their property.
author: John Locke

quote: Property is theft.
author: Proudhon

quote: Property exists by grace of the law. It is not a fact  but a legal fiction.
author: Max Stirner

quote: Mine is better than ours.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: There can be to the ownership of anything no rightful title which is not derived from the title of the producer and does not rest upon the natural right of the man to himself.
author: Henry George

quote: The instinct of ownership is fundamental in man's nature.
author: William James

quote: The reason why men enter into society is the preservation of their property.
author: John Locke

quote: Is it not lawful for me to do what I will with mine own?
author: Matthew

quote: Property is theft.
author: Proudhon

quote: Property exists by grace of the law. It is not a fact  but a legal fiction.
author: Max Stirner

quote: I shall always consider the best guesser the best prophet.
author: Cicero

quote: A prophet is not without honour  save in his own country  and in his own house.
author: Matthew

quote: I shall always consider the best guesser the best prophet.
author: Cicero

quote: A prophet is not without honour  save in his own country  and in his own house.
author: Matthew

quote: It requires a strong constitution to withstand repeated attacks of prosperity.
author: J. L. Basford

quote: Prosperity makes some friends and many enemies.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: It requires a strong constitution to withstand repeated attacks of prosperity.
author: J. L. Basford

quote: Prosperity makes some friends and many enemies.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: And pleas'd th' Almighty's orders to perform. Rides in the whirlwind and directs the storm.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Fear not  but trust in Providence  Wherever thou may'st be.
author: Thomas Haynes Bayly

quote: Dine on little  and sup on less.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: I recommend you to take care of the minutes  for the hours will take care of themselves.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: People who live in glass houses should not throw stones.
author: English proverb

quote: He that fights and runs away Will live to fight another day.
author: Old English Rhyme

quote: A psychiatrist is a man who goes to the Folies-Bergere and looks at the audience.
author: Mervyn Stockwood

quote: I am going to give my psychoanalyst one more year  then I'm going to Lourdes.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Neurosis is always a substitute for legitimate suffering.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Psychiatrists classify a person as neurotic if he suffers from his problems in living  and a psychotic if he makes others suffer.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: Schizophrenic behaviour is a special strategy that a person invents in order to live in an unlivable situation.
author: R. D. Laing

quote: If you talk to God  you are praying  if God talks to you  you have schizophrenia.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: The psychiatrist must become a fellow traveller with his patient.
author: R. D. Laing

quote: Those modern analysts  they charge so much! In my day  for five marks Freud himself would treat you. For ten marks he would treat you and press your pants. For fifteen marks Freud would let you treat him - that included a choice of any two vegetables.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Psychiatry enables us to correct our faults by confessing our parents' shortcomings.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: Psychoanalysis is confession without absolution.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: The point of therapy is get unhooked  not to thrash around on how you got hooked.
author: Maryanne Walters

quote: I can feel guilty about the past  apprehensive about the future  but only in the present can I act. The ability to be in the present moment is a major component of mental wellness.
author: Abraham Maslow

quote: Mental health problems do not affect three or four out of every five persons  but one out of one.
author: William Menninger

quote: The trouble with being a hypochondriac these days is that antibiotics have cured all the good diseases.
author: Caskie Stinnet

quote: The best cure for hypochondria is to forget about your own body and get interested in someone else's.
author: Goodman Ace

quote: Depression is the inability to construct a future.
author: Rollo May

quote: Depression is rage spread thin.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: Fortunately  analysis is not the only way to resolve inner conflicts. Life itself remains a very effective therapist.
author: Karen Homey

quote: Anyone who goes to a psychiatrist ought to have his head examined.
author: Sam Goldwyn

quote: I believe that this neglected  wounded inner child of the past is the major source of human misery.
author: John Bradshaw

quote: We would not listen to those who were wont to say the voice of the people is the voice of God  for the voice of the mob is near akin to madness.
author: Alcuin

quote: The public! why  the public's nothing better than a great baby.
author: Thomas Chalmers

quote: The public! the public! How many fools does it take to make up a public?
author: Sebastien Chamfort

quote: The public have neither shame nor gratitude.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: It is to the middle class we must look for the safety of England.
author: William Thackeray

quote: The public be damned.
author: W. H. Vanderbilt

quote: I never knew an enemy to puns who was not an ill-natured man.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Of puns it has been said that those most dislike who are least able to utter them.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: He that would pun would pick a pocket.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Unfaithfulness in the keeping of an appointment is an act of clear dishonesty. You may as well borrow a person's money as his time.
author: Horace Mann

quote: I have always been a quarter of an hour before my time  and it has made a man of me.
author: Lord Horatio Nelson

quote: Let them stew in their own grease (or juice).
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: My object all sublime I shall achieve in time  -  To let the punishment fit the crime.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: It is more dangerous that even a guilty person should be punished without the forms of law than that he should escape.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: One man meets an infamous punishment for that crime which confers a diadem upon another.
author: Juvenal

quote: No one should be twice punished for one crime.
author: Legal maxim

quote: The object of punishment is  prevention from evil  it never can be made impulsive to good.
author: Horace Mann

quote: The punishment of criminals should be of use  when a man is hanged he is good for nothing.
author: Voltaire

quote: The best is the cheapest.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Quality  not quantity  is my measure.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: Many individuals have  like uncut diamonds  shining qualities beneath a rough exterior.
author: Juvenal

quote: Ye are the salt of the earth: but if the salt have lost his savour  wherewith shall it be salted?
author: Matthew

quote: Nothing endures but personal qualities.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: In quarreling the truth is always lost.
author: Syrus

quote: A fool may ask more questions in an hour than a wise man can answer in seven years.
author: English proverb

quote: It is not every question that deserves an answer.
author: Syrus

quote: Ask me no questions  and I'll tell you no fibs.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: No  Groucho is not my real name. I am breaking it in for a friend.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: I have admired W.C. Fields since the day he advanced upon Baby LeRoy with an ice pick. Any man who hates dogs and babies can't be all bad.
author: Leo Rosten

quote: One bliss for which there is no match is when you itch to up and scratch.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: Only mediocrity can be trusted to be always at its best.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: Only two things are infinite  the universe and human stupidity  and I'm not sure about the former.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Sometimes a cigar is only a cigar.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: The blind man is laughing at the bald head.
author: Persian proverb

quote: The net of the sleeper catches fish.
author: Greek proverb

quote: There ain't no answer. There ain't gonna be any answer. There never has been an answer. That's the answer.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: We are the people our parents warned us about.
author: Graffiti

quote: Worthless as wither'd weeds.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: You must lose a fly to catch a trout.
author: George Herbert

quote: Rip van Winkle was lazy.
author: Robert H. Gurney

quote: A diplomat these days is nothing but a head waiter who is allowed to sit down occasionally.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: A man surprised is half beaten.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: A nimble sixpence is better than a slow shilling.
author: English proverb

quote: Brevity is the soul of lingerie.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: Every path has its puddle.
author: Old saying

quote: Every time I look at you I get a fierce desire to be lonesome.
author: Oscar Levant

quote: Evil spelled backward is live.
author: Graffiti

quote: Forgetting of a wrong is a mild revenge.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: He looked at me as if I was a side dish he hadn't ordered.
author: Ring Lardner

quote: Heat  madam! It was so dreadful that I found there was nothing for it but to take off my flesh and sit in my bones.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: I am an atheist. I don't believe in Zeus.
author: Graffiti

quote: I don't deserve this  but I have arthritis  and I don't deserve that either.
author: Jack Benny

quote: I don't know much about being a millionaire  but I'll bet I'd be darling at it.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: I never said "I want to be alone." I only said "I want to be left alone." There is all the difference.
author: Greta Garbo

quote: In baiting a mousetrap with cheese  always leave room for the mouse.
author: Saki

quote: In the ant's house  the dew is a flood.
author: Old saying

quote: India is a geographical term. It is no more a United Nation than the Equator.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Judas needed the money for a sick friend.
author: Graffiti

quote: Judge Crater - please call your office.
author: Graffiti

quote: It is a sobering thought  that when Mozart was my age  he had been dead for two years.
author: Tom Lehrer

quote: Show me a man with both feet on the ground and I'll show you a man who can't put his pants on.
author: Arthur K. Watson

quote: My idea of an agreeable person is a person who agrees with me.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Nothing is impossible for the person who doesn't have to do it.
author: Welter's Law

quote: He has all of the virtues I dislike and none of the vices I admire.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Sherard Blaw  the dramatist who had discovered himself  and who had given so unstintingly of his discovery to the world.
author: Saki

quote: The Right Honourable gentleman is indebted to his memory for his jests and to his imagination for his facts.
author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan

quote: Her face was her chaperone.
author: Rupert Hughes

quote: Angels fly because they take themselves lightly.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: When people don't want to come  nothing will stop them.
author: Sol Hurok

quote: Venice is like eating an entire box of chocolate liqueurs in one go.
author: Truman Capote

quote: More and more these days I find myself pondering on how to reconcile my net income with my gross habits.
author: John Kirk Nelson

quote: A verbal contract isn't worth the paper it's written on.
author: Sam Goldwyn

quote: Epigram: a wisecrack that has played Carnegie Hall.
author: Oscar Levant

quote: Include me out.
author: Sam Goldwyn

quote: A hole is nothing at all  but you can break your neck in it.
author: Austin O'Malley

quote: Mother: It's broccoli  dear. Child: I say it's spinach  and I say the hell with it.
author: Carl Rose

quote: Flint must be an extremely wealthy town  I see that each of you bought two or three seats.
author: Victor Borge

quote: In uplifting  get underneath.
author: George Ade

quote: When the mouse laughs at the cat there's a hole nearby.
author: Nigerian proverb

quote: Fatigue is the best pillow.
author: Hindu proverb

quote: The ugliest of trades have their moments of pleasure. Now  if I was a grave digger  or even a hangman  there are some people I could work for with a great deal of enjoyment.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: What happens to the hole when the cheese is gone?
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: God made me on a morning when he had nothing else to do.
author: C. F. Lloyd

quote: When Babe Ruth was asked in 1930 how he felt about making more money that the President of the United States  he replied 'I had a better year than he (Herbert Hoover) did.' When Tom Snyder was asked in 1977 how he felt about making more money per year than President Carter  he replied  'I have to go out and buy my own 707.'
author: Cleveland Amory

quote: Nothing succeeds like one's own successor.
author: Clarence H. Hinclcs

quote: Whom the gods wish to destroy  they first call promising.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: In California everyone goes to a therapist  is a therapist  or is a therapist going to a therapist.
author: Truman Capote

quote: We also serve who only punctuate.
author: Brian Moore

quote: Every director bites the hand that lays the golden egg.
author: Sam Goldwyn

quote: If Roosevelt were alive he'd turn in his grave.
author: Sam Goldwyn

quote: Automatic simply means that you can't repair it yourself.
author: Frank Capra

quote: A thick skin is a gift from God.
author: Konrad Adenauer

quote: While you're saving your face you're losing your ass. Never trust a man whose eyes are too close to his nose. I never trust a man unless I've got his pecker in my pocket. Better inside the tent pissing out than outside the tent pissing in.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: Parsely is gharsley.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: Epitaph to a waiter: By and by God caught his eye.
author: David McCord

quote: A dimple in the chin  a devil within.
author: Irish proverb

quote: Some people approach every problem with an open mouth.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: The butler entered the room  a solemn procession of one.
author: P. G. Wodehouse

quote: And what's a butterfly? At best  He's but a caterpillar  drest.
author: John Grey

quote: If I look like this  I need the trip.
author: Gloria Swanson

quote: As old as the itch.
author: English proverb

quote: Early to bed  early to rise  work like hell  and advertise.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: When you have got an elephant by the hind leg  and he is trying to run away  it is best to let him run.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Too much of a good thing can be wonderful.
author: Mae West

quote: All would live long  but none would be old.
author: Proverbs

quote: Bland as a Jesuit  sober as a hymn.
author: William Ernest Henley

quote: I never forget a face  but in your case I'll make an exception.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: 'Are you lost daddy?' I asked tenderly. 'Shut up ' he explained.
author: Ping Lardner

quote: Geography is about maps  But biography is about chaps.
author: E. C. Bentley

quote: In the world of mules there are no rules.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: There are some people so addicted to exaggeration that they can't tell the truth without lying.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Since the house is on fire let us warm ourselves.
author: Italian saying

quote: I used to be snow-white . . . but I drifted.
author: Mae West

quote: Equal opportunity is good  but special privilege even better.
author: Anna Chennault

quote: It's better to be quotable than to be honest.
author: Tom Stoppard

quote: A man of words and not of deeds  Is like a garden full of weeds.
author: English proverb

quote: I don't see what's wrong with giving Bobby a little experience before he starts to practise law.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Shake a bridle over a Yorkshireman's grave  and he'll rise and steal a horse.
author: Lancashire proverb

quote: An indecent mind is a perpetual feast.
author: Old saying

quote: If you can't bite  don't show your teeth.
author: Yiddish proverb

quote: Don't quote me  that's what you heard  not what I said.
author: Lawrence K. Frank

quote: Thin people are beautiful but fat people are adorable.
author: Jackie Gleason

quote: I had always assumed that cliche was a suburb of Paris  until I discovered it to be a street in Oxford.
author: Philip Guedalla

quote: When I'm good  I'm very good  but when I'm bad  I'm better.
author: Mae West

quote: The race to which we belong is the most arrogant and rapacious  the most exclusive and indomitable in history. All other races have been its enemies or its victims.
author: John Ingalls

quote: After the rain cometh the fair weather.
author: Aesop

quote: It never rains but it pours.
author: English proverb

quote: Be still  sad heart  and cease repining  Behind the clouds is the sun still shining  Thy fate is the common fate of all  Into each life some rain must fall  Some days must be dark and dreary.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: I know Sir John will go  though he was sure it would rain cats and dogs.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Vexed sailors curse the rain for which poor shepherds prayed in vain.
author: Edmund Waller

quote: A rainbow in the morning Is the Shepherd's warning  But a rainbow at night Is the Shepherd's delight.
author: Old Weather Rhyme

quote: Reading maketh a full man.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: Reading is to the mind  what exercise is to the body.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: In science  read  by preference  the newest works  in literature  the oldest. The classic literature is always modern.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quote: My early and invincible love of reading  I would not exchange for the treasures of India.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: When I am reading a book  whether wise or silly  it seems to me to be alive and talking to me.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Expect nothing and life will be velvet.
author: Lisa Gardiner

quote: What is destructive is impatience  haste  expecting too much too fast.
author: May Sarton

quote: No one has ever loved anyone the way everyone wants to be loved.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: If you expect perfection from other people  your whole life is a series of disappointments  grumbling and complaints. If  on the contrary  you pitch your expectations low  taking folks as the inefficient creatures which they are  you are frequently surprised by having them perform better than you had hoped.
author: Bruce Barton

quote: A pint can't hold a quart-if it holds a pint it is doing all that can be expected of it.
author: Margaret Deland

quote: Truth has rough flavors if we bite it through.
author: George Eliot

quote: What had seemed easy in imagination was rather hard in reality.
author: L. M. Montgomery

quote: You can't move so fast that you try to change [a situation] faster than people can accept it. That doesn't mean you do nothing  but it means that you do the things that need to be done according to priority.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: He that will have a perfect brother must resign himself to remaining brotherless.
author: Italian proverb

quote: Who ever is adequate? We all create situations which others can't live up to  then break our hearts at them because they don't.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Friendships aren't perfect  and yet they are very precious. For me  not expecting perfection all in one place was a great release.
author: Letty Cottin Pogrebin

quote: The way to achieve happiness is to have a high standard for yourself and a medium one for everyone else.
author: Marcelene Cox

quote: Life is not a spectacle or a feast  it is a predicament.
author: George Santayana

quote: To expect too much is to have a sentimental view of life  and this is a softness that ends in bitterness.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: Because you're not what I would have you be  I blind myself to who  in truth  you are.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: No one from the beginning of time has had security.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: No one is happy all his life long.
author: Euripides

quote: Vex not thy spirit at the course of things  they heed not thy vexation. How ludicrous and outlandish is astonishment at anything that may happen in life.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: There are philosophies which are unendurable not because men are cowards  but because they are men.
author: Ludwig Lewisohn

quote: When I decided to go into politics I weighed the cost: I would get criticism. But I went ahead. So when the virulent criticism came I wasn't surprised. I was better able to handle it.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: If you want a place in the sun  you've got to put up with a few blisters.
author: Abigail Van Buren

quote: Never let life's hardships disturb you ... no one can avoid problems  not even saints or sages.
author: Nichiren Daishonen

quote: Life is made up of sobs  sniffles  and smiles  with sniffles predominating.
author: O. Henry

quote: The scornful nostril and the high head gather not the odors that lie on the track of truth.
author: George Eliot

quote: Expecting the world to treat you fairly because you are a good person is a little like expecting the bull not to attack you because you're a vegetarian.
author: Dennis Wholey

quote: When nobody around you seems to measure up  it's time to check your yardstick.
author: Bill Lemley

quote: Life to the great majority is only a constant struggle for mere existence  with the certainty of losing it at last.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Marriage is not just spiritual communion and passionate embraces  marriage is also three meals a day  sharing the workload and remembering to carry out the trash.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: We [Americans] cheerfully assume that in some mystic way love conquers all  that good outweighs evil in the just balances of the universe and that at the eleventh hour something gloriously triumphant will prevent the worst before it happens.
author: Brooks Atkinson

quote: There is no such thing as something for nothing.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: Free man is by necessity insecure  thinking man is by necessity uncertain.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: It is arrogance to expect that life will always be music.... Harmony  like a following breeze at sea  is the exception. In a world where most things wind up broken or lost  our lot is to tack and tune.
author: Harvey Oxenhorn

quote: Being unready and ill-equipped is what you have to expect in life. It is the universal predicament. It is your lot as a human being to lack what it takes. Circumstances are seldom right. You never have the capacities  the strength  the wisdom  the virtue you ought to have. You must always do with less than you need in a situation vastly different from what you would have chosen as appropriate for your special endowments.
author: Charlton Ogburn

quote: In nature there are neither rewards or punishments-there are consequences.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: Hope for a miracle. But don't depend on one.
author: Talmud

quote: Life is a perilous voyage.
author: Palladas

quote: One must not hope to be more than one can be.
author: Nicolas de Chamfort

quote: The whole point of getting things done is knowing what to leave undone.
author: Lady Stella Reading

quote: We expect more of ourselves than we have any right to.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Don't fool yourself that you are going to have it all. You are not. Psychologically  having it all is not even a valid concept. The marvelous thing about human beings is that we are perpetually reaching for the stars. The more we have  the more we want. And for this reason  we never have it all.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: Try as hard as we may for perfection  the net result of our labors is an amazing variety of imperfectness. We are surprised at our own versatility in being able to fail in so many different ways.
author: Samuel McChord Crothers

quote: We set up harsh and unkind rules against ourselves. No one is born without faults. That man is best who has fewest.
author: Horace

quote: I can't write a book commensurate with Shakespeare  but I can write a book by me.
author: Sir Walter Raleigh

quote: I have done what I could do in life  and if I could not do better  I did not deserve it. In vain I have tried to step beyond what bound me.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: The man with insight enough to admit his limitations comes nearest to perfection.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: The one important thing I have learned over the years is the difference between taking one's work seriously and taking one's self seriously. The first is imperative  and the second is disastrous.
author: Margaret Fontey

quote: Growth begins when we start to accept our own weakness.
author: Jean Vanier

quote: Of all the young men in America  only a few hundred can get into major league baseball  and of these only a handful in a decade can get into the Hall of Fame. So it goes in all human activity. ... Some become multimillionaires and chairmen of the board  and some of us must be content to play baseball at company picnics or manage a credit union without pay.
author: William Feather

quote: At thirty a man should know himself like the palm of his hand  know the exact number of his defects and qualities. ... And  above all  accept these things.
author: Albert Camus

quote: No man can climb out beyond the limitations of his own character.
author: John Morley

quote: You can't make the Duchess of Windsor into Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm. The facts of life are very stubborn things.
author: Cleveland Amory

quote: Sometimes it is more important to discover what one cannot do  than what one can do.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: Learn to ... be what you are  and learn to resign with a good grace all that you are not.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: To do all that one is able to do is to be a man  to do all that one would like to do is to be a god.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: No one is expected to achieve the impossible.
author: French proverb

quote: A hero is a man who does what he can.
author: Romain Rolland

quote: It is only fools who keep straining at high C all their lives.
author: Charles Dudley Warner

quote: May God ... let me strive for attainable things.
author: Pindar

quote: Despair is the price one pays for setting himself an impossible aim.
author: Graham Greene

quote: We would have to settle for the elegant goal of becoming ourselves.
author: William Styron

quote: A great obstacle to happiness is to expect too much happiness.
author: Bernard de Fontenelle

quote: There is a proper balance between not asking enough of oneself and asking or expecting too much.
author: May Sarton

quote: I hope to work  support my children and die quietly without pain.
author: Sean Connery

quote: As we advance in life  we learn the limits of our abilities.
author: J. A. Froude

quote: Striving for excellence motivates you  striving for perfection is demoralizing.
author: Dr. Harriet Braiker

quote: It is enough that I am of value to somebody today.
author: Hugh Prather

quote: A tomb now suffices him for whom the whole world was not sufficient.
author: Alexander the Great

quote: To wish to act like angels while we are still in this world is nothing but folly.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: It isn't important to come out on top  what matters is to be the one who comes out alive.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task  but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
author: Helen Keller

quote: I cannot do everything  but still I can do something  and because I cannot do everything  I will not refuse to do something I can do.
author: Edward Everett Hale

quote: Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

quote: Happy the man who early learns the wide chasm that lies between his wishes and his powers.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: [Being a parent] is tough. If you just want a wonderful little creature to love  you can get a puppy.
author: Barbara Walters

quote: You never conquer a mountain. You stand on the summit a few moments  then the wind blows your footprints away.
author: Arlene Blum

quote: If we are to survive on this planet  there must be compromises.
author: Storm Jameson

quote: Real life is  to most men ... a perpetual compromise between the ideal and the possible.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: He who cannot do what he wants must make do with what he can.
author: Terence

quote: What has always made a hell on earth has been that man has tried to make it his heaven.
author: Friedrich Holderlin

quote: Good is not good  where better is expected.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Nobody has things just as he would like them. The thing to do is to make a success with what material I have. It is a sheer waste of time and soul-power to imagine what I would do if things were different. They are not different.
author: Dr. Frank Crane

quote: People are lucky and unlucky ... according to the ratio between what they get and what they have been led to expect.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: We must like what we have when we don't have what we like.
author: Roger de Rabutin

quote: Better is the enemy of the good.
author: Voltaire

quote: If you aspire to the highest place  it is no disgrace to stop at the second  or even the third  place.
author: Cicero

quote: Genius does what it must  talent does what it can.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: A hero is a man who does what he can.
author: Romain Rolland

quote: The resistance to the unpleasant situation is the root of suffering.
author: Ram Dass

quote: Each of us does  in effect  strike a series of "deals " or compromises  between the wants and longings of the inner self  and an outer environment that offers certain possibilities and sets certain limitations.
author: Maggie Scarf

quote: Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps  for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are  and what they might have been.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: We do not write as we want  but as we can.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Every creator painfully experiences the chasm between his inner vision and its ultimate expression. The chasm is never completely bridged. We all have the conviction  perhaps illusory  that we have much more to say than appears on the paper.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: A body shouldn't heed what might be. He's got to do with what is.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: The chief pang of most trials is not so much the actual suffering itself as our own spirit of resistance to it.
author: Jean Nicholas Grou

quote: The greatest and most important problems in life are all in a certain sense insoluble. They can never be solved  but only outgrown.
author: Carl Jung

quote: The art of living lies less in eliminating our troubles than in growing with them.
author: Bernard M. Baruch

quote: Life has not taught me to expect nothing  but she has taught me not to expect success to be the inevitable result of my endeavors.
author: Alan Paton

quote: Knowledge of what is possible is the beginning of happiness.
author: George Santayana

quote: Don't spend time beating on a wall  hoping to transform it into a door.
author: Dr. Laura Schlessinger

quote: If I were to wish for anything  I should not wish for wealth and power  but for the passionate sense of the potential  for the eye which  ever young and ardent  sees the possible ... what wine is so sparkling  so fragrant  so intoxicating  as possibility!
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Wisdom never kicks at the iron walls it can't bring down.
author: Olive Schreiner

quote: It is impossible to control creation.
author: Evelyn Scott

quote: To seek fulfillment is to invite frustration.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: Half the unhappiness in the world is due to the failure of plans which were never reasonable  and often impossible.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: There is an illusion that has much to do with ... most of our unhappiness. ... We expect too much.
author: Joseph Farrell

quote: A fool or idiot is one who expects things to happen that never can happen.
author: George Eliot

quote: Life is a compromise of what your ego wants to do  what experience tells you to do  and what your nerves let you do.
author: Bruce Crampton

quote: No  Doctor  I don't want to grow young again. I just want to keep on growing old.
author: Madame de Rothschild

quote: What we call reality is an agreement that people have arrived at to make life more livable.
author: Louise Nevelson

quote: There is no such thing as pure pleasure  some anxiety always goes with it.
author: Ovid

quote: No country can act wisely simultaneously in every part of the globe at every moment of time.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: The most important thing in marriage is not happiness  but stability.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quote: Nothing is so good as it seems beforehand.
author: George Eliot

quote: Prospect is often better than possession.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: The hours we pass with happy prospects in view are more pleasing than those crowned with fruition.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: 'Tis expectation makes a blessing dear  heaven were not heaven if we knew what it were.
author: Sir John Sucking

quote: Life is so constructed that the event does not  cannot  will not  match the expectation.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: There is no greater enemy to those who would please than expectation.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Too many people miss the silver lining because they're expecting gold.
author: Maurice Setter

quote: For people who live on expectations  to face up to their realization is something of an ordeal.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: My expectations-which I extended whenever I came close to accomplishing my goals-made it impossible ever to feel satisfied with my success.
author: Ellen Sue Stern

quote: Every attempt to make war easy and safe will result in humiliation and disaster.
author: General William Sherman

quote: I sincerely wish war was a pleasanter and easier business than it is  but it does not admit of holidays.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: There is many a boy here today who looks on war as all glory  but boys  it is all hell.
author: General William T. Sherman

quote: War is not an adventure. It is a disease. It is like typhus.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: In combat  life is short  nasty and brutish. The issues of national policy which brought him into war are irrelevant to the combat soldier  he is concerned with his literal life chances.
author: Charles E. Moskos

quote: In war  more than anywhere else in the world  things happen differently from what we had expected  and look differently when near from what they did at a distance.
author: Karl von Clausewitz

quote: In spite of all of the training you get and the precautions you take to keep yourself alive  it's largely a matter of luck that decides whether or not you get killed.
author: James Jones

quote: Moderation in war is imbecility.
author: Admiral John Fisher

quote: When one's expectations are reduced to zero  one really appreciates everything one does have.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: I like trees because they seem more resigned to the way they have to live than other things do.
author: Willa Cather

quote: Life didn't promise to be wonderful.
author: Teddy Pendergrass

quote: We never enjoy perfect happiness  our most fortunate successes are mingled with sadness  some anxieties always perplex the reality of our satisfaction.
author: Pierre Corneille

quote: Do not commit the error  common among the young  of assuming that if you cannot save the whole of mankind you have failed.
author: Jan de Hartog

quote: The art of living lies less in eliminating our troubles than in growing with them.
author: Bernard M. Baruch

quote: If one considered life as a simple loan  one would perhaps be less exacting.
author: Eugene Delacroix

quote: Why are we surprised when fig trees bear figs?
author: Margaret Titzel

quote: Those who aim at great deeds must also suffer greatly.
author: Plutarch

quote: I have nothing to offer but blood  toil  tears  and sweat.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: There's no map  there's no master plan  there's just people.
author: Stingray

quote: Every writer I know has trouble writing.
author: Joseph Heller

quote: Men expect too much  do too little.
author: Allen Tate

quote: Human kind cannot bear very much reality.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: If anything is poisoning our lives and weakening our society  it is reality - and not the fabrication of television writers and producers.
author: Martin Moloney

quote: There is no reality except the one contained within us. That is why so many people live such an unreal life. They take the images outside them for reality and never allow the world within to assert itself.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: Nothing which is at all times and in every way agreeable to us can have objective reality. It is of the very nature of the real that it should have sharp corners and rough edges  that it should be resistant  should be itself. Dream-furniture is the only kind on which you never stub your toes or bang your knee.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Facts as facts do not always create a spirit of reality  because reality is a spirit.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: We take our shape  it is true  within and against that cage of reality bequeathed us at our birth  and yet it is precisely through our dependence on this reality that we are most endlessly betrayed.
author: James Baldwin

quote: You too must not count overmuch on your reality as you feel it today  since  like that of yesterday  it may prove an illusion for you tomorrow.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: All our interior world is reality - and that perhaps more so than our apparent world.
author: Marc Chagall

quote: The field of consciousness is tiny. It accepts only one problem at a time. Get into a fist fight  put your mind on the strategy of the fight  and you will not feel the other fellow's punches.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: A life based on reason will always require to be balanced by an occasional bout of violent and irrational emotion  for the instinctual tribes must be satisfied.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Analysis kills spontaneity. The grain once ground into flour springs and germinates no more.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: I like reality. It tastes of bread.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: The time is comin' whin not more thin hath iv us'll be rale  an' th' rest'll be rubber  (plastic!)
author: Finley Peter Dunne

quote: To see what is in front of one's nose needs a constant struggle.
author: George Orwell

quote: We do not fight for the real but for shadows we make A flag is a piece of cloth and a word is a sound  But we make them something neither cloth nor a sound Tokens of love and hate  black sorcery stones.
author: Stephen Vincent Benet

quote: Where I cannot satisfy my reason  I love to humour my fancy.
author: Sir Thomas Browne

quote: When the human mind exists in the light of reason and no more than reason  we may say with absolute certainty that Man and all that made him will be in that instant gone.
author: Loren Eiseley

quote: I have hardly ever known a mathematician who was capable of reasoning.
author: Plato

quote: Reason is God's gift  but so are the passions. Reason is as guilty as passion.
author: Cardinal Newman

quote: The man who is master of his passions is Reason's slave.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Human reason needs only to will more strongly than fate  and she is fate.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: Reason deserves to be called a prophet  for in showing up the consequence and effect of our actions in the present  does it not tell us what the future will be?
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: The difference between the reason of man and the instinct of the beast is this  that the beast does but know  but the man knows that he knows.
author: John Donne

quote: Reason is also choice.
author: John Milton

quote: Reason is an emotion for the sexless.
author: Heathcote Williams

quote: The last advance of reason is to recognize that it is surpassed by innumerable things  it is feeble if it cannot realize that.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: All our reasoning ends in surrender to feeling.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Reason is the mistress and queen of all things.
author: Cicero

quote: He who will not reason  is a bigot  he who cannot is a fool  and he who dares not  is a slave.
author: William Drummond

quote: Reason can in general do more than blind force.
author: Gallus

quote: If I go to heaven I want to take my reason with me.
author: Charles J. Ingersoll

quote: Error of opinion may be tolerated where reason is left free to combat it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Human reason is like a drunken man on horseback  set it up on one side  and it tumbles over on the other.
author: Martin Luther

quote: You know  my friends  with what a brave carouse I made a second marriage in my house  Divorced old barren reason from my bed  And took the daughter of the vine to spouse.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: The feast of reason and the flow of soul.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Many are destined to reason wrongly  others  not to reason at all: and others to persecute those who do reason.
author: Voltaire

quote: There are so many people with all kinds of lucky things happening to them  and they don't know how to use it.
author: Rocky Aoki

quote: Probably any successful career has "X" number of breaks in it  and maybe the difference between successful people and those who aren't superachievers is taking advantage of those breaks.
author: Joan Ganz Cooney

quote: To get it right  be born with luck or else make it.
author: Ruth Gordon

quote: You must always be open to your luck. You cannot force it  but you can recognize it.
author: Henry Moore

quote: Genius is the gold in the mine  talent is the miner that works and brings it out.
author: Lady Marguerite Blessington

quote: It is one thing to be gifted and quite another thing to be worthy of one's own gift.
author: Nadia Boulanger

quote: Talent on its own sat gracefully only on the very young. After a certain age it was what you did with it that counted.
author: Liza Cody

quote: A wise man turns chance into good fortune.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Luck ... taps  once in a lifetime  at everybody's door  but if industry does not open it  luck goes away.
author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

quote: When something bad happens to me  I think I'm able to deal with it in a pretty good way. That makes me lucky. Some people fall apart at the first little thing that happens.
author: Christie Brinkley

quote: It's funny  but... you're sort of a moving target for fortune  and you never know when it will befall you.
author: Thomas McGuane

quote: Lady Luck generally woos those who earnestly  enthusiastically  unremittingly woo her.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: What helps luck is a habit of watching for opportunities  of having a patient  but restless mind  of sacrificing one's ease or vanity  of uniting a love of detail to foresight  and of passing through hard times bravely and cheerfully.
author: Charles Victor Cherbuliez

quote: Luck is believing you're lucky.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: I think that one can have luck if one tries to create an atmosphere of spontaneity.
author: Federico Fellini

quote: Each man's character shapes his fortunes.
author: Latin proverb
