quote: Chance works for us when we are good captains.
author: George Meredith

quote: Motivation triggers luck.
author: Mike Wallace

quote: Good and bad luck is a synonym  in the great majority of instances  for good and bad judgment.
author: John Chatfield

quote: Luck is a combination of confidence and getting the breaks.
author: Christy Mathewson

quote: I was born lucky  and I have lived lucky. What I had was used. What I still have is being used. Lucky.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: Luck is largely a matter of paying attention.
author: Susan M. Dodd

quote: Your luck is how you treat people.
author: Bridget O'Donnell

quote: The only sure thing about luck is that it will change.
author: Bret Harte

quote: The man who glories in his luck may be overthrown by destiny.
author: Euripides

quote: There is in the worst of fortune the best of chances for a happy change.
author: Euripides

quote: It is more easy to get a favor from fortune than to keep it.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Since luck's a nine days' wonder  wait their end.
author: Euripides

quote: Fortune is with you for an hour  and against you for ten!
author: Arab proverb

quote: Breaks balance out. The sun don't shine on the same old dog's rear end every day.
author: Darrell Royal

quote: What the reason of the ant laboriously drags into a heap  the wind of accident will collect in one breath.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: Fortune is like the market  where many times  if you can stay a little  the price will fall.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: The profits of good luck are perishable  if you build on fortune  you build on sand  the more advancement you achieve  the more dangers you run.
author: Marquis de Racan

quote: Every possession and every happiness is but lent by chance for an uncertain time  and may therefore be demanded back the next hour.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Life is full of chances and changes  and the most prosperous of men may ... meet with great misfortunes.
author: Aristotle

quote: At twenty a man is full of fight and hope. He wants to reform the world. When he's seventy he still wants to reform the world  but he knows he can't.
author: Clarence S. Darrow

quote: Reform must come from within  not from without. You cannot legislate for virtue.
author: James Cardinal Gibbons

quote: The hole and the patch should be commensurate.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: To make a crooked stick straight  we bend it the contrary way.
author: Michel Montaigne

quote: An indefinable something is to be done  in a way nobody knows how  at a time nobody knows when  that will accomplish nobody knows what.
author: Thomas B. Read

quote: Very frequently  feminine activity also expresses itself in what is largely a retrospectively oriented pondering over what we ought to have done differently in life  and how we ought to have done it  or  as if under compulsion  we make up strings of causal connections. We like to call this thinking  though  on the contrary  it is a form of mental activity that is strangely pointless and unproductive  a form that really leads only to self-torture.
author: Emma Jung

quote: The only causes of regret are laziness  outbursts of temper  hurting others  prejudice  jealousy  and envy.
author: Germaine Greer

quote: If you have behaved badly  repent  make what amends you can and address yourself to the task of behaving better next time. On no account brood over your wrongdoing. Rolling in the muck is not the best way of getting clean.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: You always feel when you look it straight in the eye that you could have put more into it  could have let yourself go and dug harder.
author: Emily Carr

quote: When one door closes another opens. But we often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door that we fail to see the one that has opened for us.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

quote: No doing without some ruing.
author: Sigrid Undset

quote: Nobody gets to live life backward. Look ahead  that is where your future lies.
author: Ann Landers

quote: Were it not better to forget Than to remember and regret?
author: L. E. Landon

quote: Regret for the things we did can be tempered by time  it is regret for the things we did not do that is inconsolable.
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: Always repenting of wrongs done will never bring my heart to rest.
author: Ji Kang

quote: Should-haves solve nothing. It's the next thing to happen that needs thinking about.
author: Alexandra Ripley

quote: Regret is an appalling waste of energy  you can't build on it  it is good only for wallowing.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: I have always found that each step we take in life is to be regretted-if we once begin to wonder how many other steps might have been possible.
author: John Oliver Hobbes

quote: Let the dead Past bury its dead!
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: "The horror of that moment " the King went on  "I shall never forget." "You will  though " the Queen said  "if you don't make a memorandum of it."
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: Reflect upon your present blessings  of which every man has many-not on your past misfortunes  of which all men have some.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: They say you should not suffer through the past. You should be able to wear it like a loose garment  take it off and let it drop.
author: Eva Jessye

quote: The only thing I regret about my past is the length of it. If I had to live my life again  I'd make the same mistakes  only sooner.
author: Tallulah Bankhead

quote: There is no greater sorrow than to recall a happy time in the midst of wretchedness.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: We should have no regrets. ... The past is finished. There is nothing to be gained by going over it. Whatever it gave us in the experiences it brought us was something we had to know.
author: Rebecca Beard

quote: One must never lose time in vainly regretting the past or in complaining against the changes which cause us discomfort  for change is the essence of life.
author: Anatole France

quote: Yesterday's errors let yesterday cover.
author: Susan Coolidge

quote: This is another day! Are its eyes blurred with maudlin grief for any wasted past? A thousand thousand failures shall not daunt! Let dust clasp dust  death  death  I am alive!
author: Don Marquis

quote: Whatever with the past has gone  the best is always yet to come.
author: Lucy Larcom

quote: Hindsight is always zo/20.
author: Billy Wilder

quote: I respect only those who resist me  but cannot tolerate them.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: The easiest kind of relationship for me is with 10 000 people. The hardest is with one.
author: Joan Baez

quote: We rarely confide in those who are better than we are.
author: Albert Camus

quote: With three or more people there is something bold in the air: direct things get said which would frighten two people alone and conscious of each inch of their nearness to one another. To be three is to be in public - you feel safe.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: It is always safe to assume that people are more subtle and less sensitive than they seem.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: At bottom the world isn't a joke. We only joke about it to avoid an issue with someone  to let someone know that we know he's there with his questions  to disarm him by seeming to have heard and done justice to his side of the standing argument.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Science may have found a cure for most evils: but it has found no remedy for the worst of them all - the apathy of human beings.
author: Helen Keller

quote: It is well to remember that the entire population of the universe  with one trifling exception  is composed of others.
author: John Andrew Holmes

quote: The opinions which we hold of one another  our relations with friends and kinsfolk are in no sense permanent  save in appearance  but are as eternally fluid as the sea itself.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: I present myself to you in a form suitable to the relationship I wish to achieve with you.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: The ultimate indignity is to be given a bedpan by a stranger who calls you by your first name.
author: Maggie Kuhn

quote: I respect only those who resist me  but cannot tolerate them.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: The easiest kind of relationship for me is with 10 000 people. The hardest is with one.
author: Joan Baez

author: Marcel Proust

quote: I present myself to you in a form suitable to the relationship I wish to achieve with you.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: The ultimate indignity is to be given a bedpan by a stranger who calls you by your first name.
author: Maggie Kuhn

quote: And so do his sisters and his cousins and his aunts! His sisters and his cousins Whom he reckons up by dozens  And his aunts!
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: No man will be respected by others who is despised by his own relatives.
author: Plautus

quote: The worst hatred is that of relatives.
author: Tacitus

quote: A firm belief atthracts facts. They come out iv holes in the ground an' cracks in th' wall to support belief  but they run away fr'm doubt.
author: Finley Peter Dunne

quote: Don't wait for the Last Judgment. It takes place every day.
author: Albert Camus

quote: A minister is coming down every generation nearer and nearer to the common level of the useful citizen - no oracle at all  but a man of more than average moral instincts  who if he knows anything  knows how little he knows.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: After all  what's a cult? It just means not enough people to make a minority.
author: The Globe and Mail

quote: Faith consists in believing when it is beyond the power of reason to believe. It is not enough that a thing be possible for it to be believed.
author: Voltaire

quote: He was of the faith chiefly in the sense that the Church he currently did not attend was Catholic.
author: Kingsley Amis

quote: As for future life  every man must judge for himself between conflicting vague probabilities.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: Heathen  n. A beknighted creature who has the folly to worship something that he can see and feel.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: I'm not really a Jew  just Jew-ish  not the whole hog.
author: Jonathan Miller

quote: If you can't believe in God the chances are your God is too small.
author: J. B. Phillips

quote: It is extremely difficult for a Jew to be converted  for how can he bring himself to believe in the divinity of - another Jew?
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: Man is a venerating animal. He venerates as easily as he purges himself. When they take away from him the gods of his fathers  he looks for others abroad.
author: Max Jacob

quote: My own mind is my own church.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: One's religion is whatever he is most interested in.
author: James M. Barrie

quote: Religion is the way we honour our ancestors' errors.
author: Mark M. Otoysao

quote: The church exists for the sake of those outside it.
author: William Temple

quote: The writers against religion  whilst they oppose every system  are wisely careful never to set up any of their own.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: The idea that He would take his attention away from the universe in order to give me a bicycle with three speeds is just so unlikely I can't go along with it.
author: Quentin Crisp

quote: The Pope is barely Catholic enough for some converts.
author: John Ayscough

quote: The three great apostles of practical atheism  that make converts without persecuting and retain them without preaching are Wealth  Health and Power.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: To tolerate everything is to teach nothing.
author: Dr. F. J. Kinsman

quote: We are a rather big-headed little species in a vast cosmos which can do without us very well.
author: Rev. George Carey

quote: When people cease to believe in God  they don't believe in nothing  they believe in anything.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Zen is a way of liberation  concerned not with discovering what is good or bad or advantageous  but what is.
author: Alan Watts

quote: Each religion  by the help of more or less myth which it takes more or less seriously  proposes some method of fortifying the human soul and enabling it to make its peace with its destiny.
author: George Santayana

quote: The good news is that Jesus is coming back. The bad news is that he's really pissed off.
author: Bob Hope

quote: Most people believe that the Christian commandments are intentionally a little too severe - like setting a clock half an hour ahead to make sure of not being late in the morning.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Three things are good in little measure and evil in large: yeast  salt and hesitation.
author: The Talmud

quote: Mystic: a person who is puzzled before the obvious  but who understands the non-existent.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Faith means intense  usually confident  belief that is not based on evidence sufficient to command assent from every reasonable person.
author: Walter Kaufmann

quote: Men will wrangle for religion  write for it  fight for it  die for it  anything but live for it.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: I have never yet met a healthy person who worries very much about his health or a really good person who worries much about his own soul.
author: J. B. S. Haldane

quote: Men are idolaters  and want something to look at and kiss and hug  or throw themselves down before  they always did  they always will  and if you don't make it of wood  you must make it of words.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: The various modes of worship which prevailed in the Roman world were all considered by the people as equally true  by the philosopher as equally false  and by the magistrate as equally useful.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: Nothing in human life  least of all in religion  is ever right until it is beautiful.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: I think if you ask people what their concept of heaven is  they would say  if they are honest  that it is a big department store  with new things every week - all the money to buy them  and maybe a little more than the neighbours.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: We have grasped the mystery of the atom  and rejected the Sermon on the Mount.
author: Omar Bradley

quote: It must require an inordinate share of vanity and presumption after enjoying so much that is good and beautiful on earth  to ask the Lord for immortality in addition to it all.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: Oysters are more beautiful than any religion . . . there's nothing in Christianity or Buddhism that quite matches the sympathetic unselfishness of an oyster.
author: Saki

quote: Don't be agnostic - be something.
author: Robert Frost

quote: A gentle Quaker  hearing a strange noise in his house one night  got up and discovered a burglar busily at work. He went and got his gun  came back and stood quietly in the doorway. 'Friend ' he said  'I would do thee no harm for the world  but thou standest where I am about to shoot.'
author: James Hines

quote: We Jews have a secret weapon in our struggle with the Arabs - we have no place to go.
author: Golda Meir

quote: Religion is a way of walking  not a way of talking.
author: Dean William R. Inge

quote: Puritanism - the haunting fear that someone  somewhere may be happy.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: The worst moment for the atheist is when he is really thankful  and has nobody to thank.
author: Dante Gabriel Rossetti

quote: The mystery of the beginning of all things is insoluble by us  and I for one must be content to remain agnostic.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: Religion converts despair  which destroys  into resignation  which submits.
author: Lady Blessington

quote: For the wonderful thing about saints is that they were human. They lost their tempers  got angry  scolded God  were egotistical or testy or impatient in their turns  made mistakes and regretted them. Still they went on doggedly blundering toward heaven.
author: Phyllis McGinley

quote: Audible at five miles  painful at three  and lethal at one.
author: Winchester Cathedral

quote: With soap baptism is a good thing.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: When a man is freed of religion  he has a better chance to live a normal and wholesome life.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: A Unitarian very earnestly disbelieves what everyone else believes.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: While I cannot be regarded as a pillar  I must be regarded as a buttress of the church  because I support it from outside.
author: Lord Melbourne

quote: Atheism is rather in the lip than in the heart of Man.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: There's no reason to bring religion into it. I think we ought to have as great a regard for religion as we can  so as to keep it out of as many things as possible.
author: Sean O'Casey

quote: If the thunder is not loud  the peasant forgets to cross himself.
author: Russian proverb

quote: Religion is the opiate of the people.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Infidel  n: in New York  one who does not believe in the Christian religion  in Constantinople  one who does.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: An atheist is a man who has no invisible means of support.
author: Fulton Sheen

quote: Yes  I am a Jew  and when the ancestors of the right honourable gentlemen were brutal savages in an unknown land  mine were priests in the Temple of Solomon.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: As for a future life  every man must judge for himself between conflicting vague possibilities.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: My theology  briefly  Is that the universe Was dictated But not signed.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: My atheism  like that of Spinoza  is true piety towards the universe and denies only gods fashioned by men in their own image  to be servants of their human interests.
author: George Santayana

quote: The voice of the people is the voice of God. (Vox populi  vox dei.)
author: Latin proverb

quote: I'm not ok - you're not ok  and that's ok.
author: Rev. William Sloane Coffin

quote: Men prefer to believe that they are degenerated angels  rather than elevated apes.
author: W. Winwood Roade

quote: You have not converted a man because you have silenced him.
author: John Morley

quote: I consider myself a Hindu  Christian  Moslem  Jew  Buddhist  and Confucian.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: If you bring forth what is within you  what you bring forth will save you. If you do not bring forth what is within you  what you do not bring forth will destroy you.
author: Jesus Christ

quote: There is a good deal too strange to be believed  nothing is too strange to have happened.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: Life has a practice of living you if you don't live it.
author: Philip Larlcin

quote: If only God would give me a clear sign  like making a large deposit in my name at a Swiss bank.
author: Woody Allen

quote: If you talk to God  you are praying  if God talks to you  you have schizophrenia.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: You want to make God laugh? Tell him your future plans.
author: Woody Allen

quote: I have a hard time believing that billions of years ago two protozoa bumped into each other under a volcanic cesspool and evolved into Cindy Crawford.
author: Robert G. Lee

quote: I do benefits for all religions. ... I'd hate to blow the hereafter on a technicality.
author: Bob Hope

quote: My ancestors wandered lost in the wilderness for forty years because even in biblical times men would not stop to ask directions.
author: Elayne Boosler

quote: The Ten Commandments don't tell you what you ought to do: They only put ideas into your head.
author: Elizabeth Bibesco

quote: I generally avoid temptation  unless I can't resist it.
author: Mae West

quote: A church is a hospital for sinners  not a museum for saints.
author: Abigail Van Buren

quote: Moral indignation is jealousy with a halo.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: There are no atheists on turbulent airplanes.
author: Erica Jong

quote: I wanted to become an atheist but I gave it up. They have no holidays.
author: Henny Youngman

quote: An atheist is a man who has no invisible means of support.
author: John Buchan

quote: I know what I'm giving up for Lent: my New Year's resolutions.
author: Henny Youngman

quote: Many families think of church as if it was a convention - they send one delegate.
author: Wayne Day

quote: When something good happens  it's a miracle  and you should wonder what God is saving up for you later.
author: Marshall Brickman

quote: The Bible tells us to love our neighbors  and also to love our enemies  probably because they are generally the same people.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: To all things clergic I am allergic.
author: Alexander Woollcott

quote: It's clear why they only served bread and wine at the Last Supper. It was a potluck . . . organized by men.
author: Patti Page

quote: When I was a kid  I used to pray every night for a new bicycle. Then I realized that the Lord  in his wisdom  didn't work that way. So I just stole one and asked him to forgive me.
author: Emo Philips

quote: If I could only see one miracle  just one miracle. Like a burning bush  or the seas part  or my uncle Sasha pick up a check.
author: Woody Allen

quote: If there's a God  why are there such things as famine and The Jerry Springer Show.
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: The first Sunday I sang in the church choir  two hundred people changed their religion.
author: Fred Allen

quote: I don't fly on account of my religion. I'm a devout coward.
author: Henny Youngman

quote: If you can't be kind  at least be vague.
author: David Powers

quote: What if the meek inherited the Earth and we had to defend ourselves from Martians?
author: Robert Orben

quote: Jesus was born on a bank holiday and died on a bank holiday. We can therefore assume that when he returns again it will also be on a bank holiday.
author: P. G. Johnson

quote: God is not a cosmic bellboy for whom we can press a button to get things.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: I didn't want to pray to God 'cause I didn't want him to know where I was.
author: Marsha Dobb

quote: A New England conscience doesn't keep you from doing anything  it just keeps you from enjoying it.
author: Morris Mandel

quote: Conscience: That which makes a boy tell his mother before his sister does.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: Conscience is the inner voice that warns us somebody may be looking.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: A Puritan is a person who lives in the fear that someone  somewhere  may be having a good time.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: My wife converted me to religion. I never believed in hell until I married her.
author: Hal Roach

quote: The service we render others is really the rent we pay for our room on Earth.
author: Wilfred Grenfell

quote: Coincidence is God's way of performing miracles anonymously.
author: Sophy Burnham

quote: I don't go to church. Kneeling bags my nylons.
author: Jan Sterling

quote: I don't see why religion and science can't get along. What's wrong with counting our blessings with a computer?
author: Robert Orben

quote: There was never law  or sect  or opinion did so much magnify goodness  as the Christian religion doth.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: One religion is as true as another.
author: Henry Burton

quote: His religion at best is an anxious wish  - like that of Rebelais  a great Perhaps.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Men will wrangle for religion  write for it  fight for it  die for it  anything but - live it.
author: Walter Colton

quote: Religion  if in heavenly truths attired  Needs only to be seen to be admired.
author: William Cowper

quote: If men are so wicked with religion  what would they be without it?
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: A good life is the only religion.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: My creed is this: Happiness is the only good. The place to be happy is here. The time to be happy is now. The way to be happy is to help make others so.
author: Charles J. Ingersoll

quote: Religion is the opium of the people.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Religion is nothing else but love to God and man.
author: William Penn

quote: He that hath no cross deserves no crown.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: The world is my country  all mankind are my brethren  and to do good is my religion.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: From listening comes wisdom and from speaking  repentance.
author: Old saying

quote: There are people who are very resourceful At being remorseful  And who apparently feel that the best way to make friends Is to do something terrible and then make amends.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: He's half absolv'd Who has confess'd.
author: Matthew Prior

quote: It is a very delicate job to forgive a man  without lowering him in his estimation  and yours too.
author: Josh Billings

quote: The sinning is the best part of repentance.
author: Arabic proverb

quote: Apology is only egotism wrong side out.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Apologize  v: to lay the foundation for a future offence.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Apology - a desperate habit  and one that is rarely cured.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Repentance is for little children.
author: Adolf Eichmann

quote: Repentance is but want of power to sin.
author: John Dryden

quote: Make it a rule of life never to regret and never look back. Regret is an appalling waste of energy  you can't build on it  it's good only for wallowing in.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: If I die  I forgive you: if I recover  we shall see.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: It is a good rule in life never to apologize. The right sort of people do not want apologies  and the wrong sort take a mean advantage of them.
author: P. G. Wodehouse

quote: God will pardon me. It's his business.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: I suppose you've heard all those wicked stories about me. Well  I've lived my life as it came and I've done bloody marvels with a bad hand.
author: Libby Holman

quote: A monarchy is a merchantman which sails well  but will sometimes strike on a rock  and go to the bottom  a republic is a raft which will never sink  but then your feet are always in water.
author: Fisher Ames

quote: It is of great importance in a republic not only to guard against the oppression of its rulers  but to guard one part of society against the injustice of the other part.
author: Alexander Hamilton

quote: A republican government is slow to move  yet when once in motion  its momentum becomes irresistible.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Republics are brought to their ends by luxury  monarchies by poverty.
author: Charles Montesquieu

quote: When I did well  I heard it never  When I did ill  I heard it ever.
author: Old English Rhyme

quote: Associate with men of good quality  if you esteem your own reputation  for it is better to be alone than in bad company.
author: George Washington

quote: Welcome death  quoth the rat  when the trap fell.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: A wise man cares not for what he cannot have.
author: George Edward Herbert

quote: That's best Which God sends. 'Twas His will: it is mine.
author: Owen Meredith

quote: Job feels the rod  Yet blesses God.
author: New England Primer

quote: I will sit down now  but the time will come when you will hear me.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: I am in earnest - I will not equivocate - I will not excuse - I will not retreat a single inch and I will be beard.
author: William Lloyd Garrison

quote: I propose to fight it out on this line if it takes all Summer.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: Tell your master that if there were as many devils at Worms as tiles on its roofs  I would enter.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Never tell your resolution beforehand.
author: John Selden

quote: He that can take rest is greater than he that can take cities.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Come unto me  all ye that labor and are heavy laden  and I will give you rest.
author: Matthew

quote: They have sown the wind  and they shall reap the whirlwind.
author: Ballou Hosea

quote: By their fruits ye shall know them.
author: Matthew

quote: The only liberty an inferior man really cherishes is the liberty to quit work  stretch out in the sun  and scratch himself.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: It is time I stepped aside for a less experienced and less able man.
author: Scott Elledge

quote: When a man retires and time is no longer a matter of urgent importance  his colleagues generally present him with a watch.
author: R. C. Sherriff

quote: The question isn't at what age I want to retire  it's at what income.
author: George Foreman

quote: Old age is when you know all the answers but nobody asks you the questions.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: I'm going to spend it all. . . why leave it to our errors?
author: Brian Morgan

quote: Constant togetherness is fine -  but only for Siamese twins.
author: Victoria Billings

quote: Retirement must be wonderful. I mean  you can suck in your stomach for only so long.
author: Burt Reynolds

quote: I used to dread getting older because I thought I would not be able to do all the things I wanted to do  but now that I am older I find that I don't want to do them.
author: Lady Nancy Astor

quote: Cessation of work is not accompanied by cessation of expenses.
author: Cato the Elder

quote: You can't put off being young until you retire.
author: Philip Larkin

quote: The role of a retired person is no longer to possess one.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: When men reach their sixties and retire  they go to pieces. Women just go right on cooking.
author: Gail Sheehy

quote: Retirement: statutory senility.
author: Emmett O'Donnell

quote: Two weeks is about the ideal length of time to retire.
author: Alex Comfort

quote: Absence of occupation is not rest  A mind quite vacant is a mind distress'd.
author: William Cowper

quote: Far from the madding crowd's ignoble strife.
author: Thomas Gray

quote: Few men of action have been able to make a graceful exit at the appropriate time.
author: Malcolm Muggeridge

quote: Dismiss the old horse in good time  lest he fail in the lists and the spectators laugh.
author: Horace

quote: I try to learn one new thing a week to balance the one thing I forget a week  but lately I forget three things a week.
author: Joseph Gies

quote: The mills of the gods grind slowly  but they grind exceedingly fine.
author: English proverb

quote: In taking revenge a man is but equal to his enemy  but in passing it over he is his superior.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: Vengeance is a dish that should be eaten cold.
author: English proverb

quote: Revenge is sweeter than life itself. So think fools.
author: Juvenal

quote: Vengeance is sweet.
author: William Painter

quote: Not to be provoked is best  but if moved  never correct till the fume is spent  for every stroke our fury strikes is sure to hit ourselves at last.
author: William Penn

quote: Revenge is an inhuman word.
author: Seneca

quote: A nation without the means of reform is without the means of survival.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: All reformers are bachelors.
author: George Moore

quote: Not actual suffering but the hope of better things incites people to revolt.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: The most dangerous moment for a bad government is when it begins to reform.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: Thinkers prepare the revolution  bandits carry it out.
author: Mariano Azuela

quote: Inferiors revolt in order that they may be equal  and equals that they may be superior.
author: Aristotle

quote: Resistance to tyrants is obedience to God.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: In almost any society  I think  the quality of the non-conformists is like to be just as good as  and no better than that of the conformists.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Whatever little we have gained  we have gained by agitation  while we have uniformly lost by moderation.
author: Daniel O'Connell

quote: Every generation revolts against its fathers and makes friends with its grandfathers.
author: Lewis Mumford

quote: One revolution is like one cocktail  it just gets you organized for the next.
author: Will Rogers

quote: A reformer is a guy who rides through a sewer in a glass-bottomed boat.
author: James J. Walker

quote: A reformer is one who sets forth cheerfully toward sure defeat.
author: Richard S. Childs

quote: The overwhelming pressure of mediocrity  sluggish and indomitable as a glacier  will mitigate the most violent  and depress the most exalted revolution.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: It is possible for a single individual to defy the whole might of an unjust empire to save his honour  his religion  his soul  and lay the foundation for that empire's fall or its regeneration.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: It is essential to the triumph of reform that it shall never succeed.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: By gnawing through a dyke  even a rat may drown a nation.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: The times spat at me. I spit back at the times.
author: Andrei Voznesensky

quote: All reform except a moral one will prove unavailing.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: I hold it  that a little rebellion now and then is a good thing  and as necessary in the political world as storms in the physical.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Riots are the voices of the unheard.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: If we should promise people nothing better than only revolution  they would scratch their heads and say  'Isn't it better to have good goulash?'
author: Nikita Khrushchev

quote: I survived. (J'ai vecu.)
author: Emmanuel Joseph Sieyes

quote: Big Brother is watching you.
author: George Orwell

quote: Revolutions are not about trifles  but spring from trifles.
author: Aristotle

quote: A reform is a correction of abuses  a revolution is a transfer of power.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quote: At last I perceive that in revolutions the supreme power finally rests with the most abandoned.
author: Georges Jacques Danton

quote: It is impossible to predict the time and progress of revolution. It is governed by its own more or less mysterious laws. But when it comes it moves irresistibly.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: This country  with its institutions  belongs to the people who inhabit it. Whenever they shall grow weary of the existing government they can exercise their constitutional right of amending it  or their revolutionary right to dismember or overthrow it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Let the ruling classes tremble at a Communist revolution. The proletarians have nothing to lose but their chains. They have a world to win. Working men of all countries  unite!
author: Karl Marx

quote: Revolutions are not made  they come.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: If I were an American  as I am an Englishman  while a foreign troop was landed in my country I never would lay down my arms  - never! never! never!
author: William Pitt

quote: The pleasures of the rich are bought with the tears of the poor.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: I am rich beyond the dreams of avarice.
author: Edward Moore

quote: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth  where moth and rust doth corrupt  and where thieves break through and steal.
author: Matthew

quote: A man's true wealth is the good he does in this world.
author: Mohammed

quote: It is the wretchedness of being rich that you have to live with rich people.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Nothing is so hard for those who abound in riches as to conceive how others can be in want.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Cervantes smiled Spain's chivalry away.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Resort is had to ridicule only when reason is against us.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: There is only one step from the sublime to the ridiculous.
author: Napoleon

quote: The great thing to learn about life is  first  not to do what you don't want to do  and  second  to do what you do want to do.
author: Margaret Anderson

quote: Men can starve from a lack of self-realization as much as they can from a lack of bread.
author: Richard Wright

quote: There is a need to find and sing our own song  to stretch our limbs and shake them in a dance so wild that nothing can roost there  that stirs the yearning for solitary voyage.
author: Barbara Lazear Ascher

quote: Every man has his own destiny  the only imperative is to follow it  to accept it  no matter where it leads him.
author: Henry Miller

quote: You don't get to choose how you're going to die. Or when. You can only decide how you're going to live.
author: Joan Baez

quote: I want to do it because I want to do it.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: Personality  too  is destiny.
author: Erik H. Erikson

quote: The door that nobody else will go in at  seems always to swing open widely for me.
author: Clara Barton

quote: I don't go by the rule book-I lead from the heart  not the head.
author: Diana, Princess of Wales

quote: A man should not strive to eliminate his complexes but to get into accord with them  for they are legitimately what directs his conduct in the world.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: When she stopped conforming to the conventional picture of femininity she finally began to enjoy being a woman.
author: Betty Friedan

quote: Live as you will wish to have lived when you are dying.
author: Christian Furchtegott Gellert

quote: The history of human growth is at the same time the history of every new idea heralding the approach of a brighter dawn  and the brighter dawn has always been considered illegal  outside of the law.
author: Emma Goldman

quote: The first thing is to love your sport. Never do it to please someone else. It has to be yours.
author: Peggy Fleming

quote: There is just one life for each of us: our own.
author: Euripides

quote: People are ridiculous only when they try or seem to be that which they are not.
author: Giacomo Leopardi

quote: Men are created different  they lose their social freedom and their individual autonomy in seeking to become like each other.
author: David Riesman

quote: The pain of leaving those you grow to love is only the prelude to understanding yourself and others.
author: Shirley MacLaine

quote: Of all the paths a man could strike into  there is  at any given moment  a best path ... a thing which  here and now  it were of all things wisest for him to do ... to find this path  and walk in it  is the one thing needful for him.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: I don't tell the truth any more to those who can't make use of it. I tell it mostly to myself  because it always changes me.
author: Anais Nin

quote: To feel that one has a place in life solves half the problem of contentment.
author: George E. Woodberry

quote: In my clinical experience  the greatest block to a person's development is his having to take on a way of life which is not rooted in his own powers.
author: Rollo May

quote: This is the chief thing: be not perturbed  for all things are according to the nature of the universal.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Dedication to one's work in the world is the only possible sanctifica-tion. Religion in all its forms is dedication to Someone Else's work  not yours.
author: Cynthia Ozick

quote: What's a joy to the one is a nightmare to the other.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: Nothing is good for everyone  but only relatively to some people.
author: Andre Gide

quote: What's important is finding out what works for you.
author: Henry Moore

quote: Everyone has a right to his own course of action.
author: Moliere

quote: Freedom and constraint are two aspects of the same necessity  the necessity of being the man you are  and not another. You are free to be that man  but not free to be another.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Let them know a real man  who lives as he was meant to live.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience.
author: Harper Lee

quote: There's no right way of writing. There's only your way.
author: Milton Lomask

quote: Every man must get to heaven his own way.
author: Frederick the Great

quote: There are as many ways to live and grow as there are people. Our own ways are the only ways that should matter to us.
author: Evelyn Mandel

quote: Only he who keeps his eye fixed on the far horizon will find his right road.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: Those who love a cause are those who love the life which has to be led in order to serve it.
author: Simone Weil

quote: Why not be oneself? That is the whole secret of a successful appearance. If one is a greyhound  why try to look like a Pekingese?
author: Edith Sitwell

quote: Do you know that disease and death must needs overtake us  no matter what we are doing? ... What do you wish to be doing when it overtakes you?... If you have anything better to be doing when you are so overtaken  get to work on that.
author: Epictetus

quote: I'll walk where my own nature would be leading  it vexes me to choose another guide.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: He who walks in another's tracks leaves no footprints.
author: Joan L. Brannon

quote: To be what we are  and to become what we are capable of becoming  is the only end of life.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Follow your bliss. Find where it is and don't be afraid to follow it.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: To have no set purpose in one's life is harlotry of the will.
author: Stephen McKenna

quote: A rose is a rose is a rose.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Somehow we learn who we really are and then live with that decision.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: True inward quietness ... is not vacancy  but stability-the steadfastness of a single purpose.
author: Caroline Stephen

quote: Seek out that particular mental attitude which makes you feel most deeply and vitally alive  along with which comes the inner voice which says  "This is the real me " and when you have found that attitude  follow it.
author: William James

quote: Most of our platitudes notwithstanding  self-deception remains the most difficult deception. The tricks that worked on others count for nothing in that very well-lit back alley where one keeps assignations with oneself: no winning smiles will do here  no prettily drawn list of good intentions.
author: Joan Didion

quote: No matter where I run  I meet myself there.
author: Dorothy Fields

quote: A woman who is willing to be herself and pursue her own potential runs not so much the risk of loneliness as the challenge of exposure to more interesting men-and people in general.
author: Lorraine Hansbury

quote: There is always a certain peace in being what one is  in being that completely. The condemned man has that joy.
author: Ugo Betti

quote: Be what you are. This is the first step toward becoming better than you are.
author: Julius Charles Hare

quote: As you go along your road in life  you will  if you aim high enough  also meet resistance ... but no matter how tough the opposition may seem  have courage still-and persevere.
author: Madeleine Albright

quote: When a just cause reaches its flood-tide  as ours has done ...  whatever stands in the way must fall before its overwhelming power.
author: Carrie Chapman Catt

quote: The first and worst of all frauds is to cheat one's self. All sin is easy after that.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: To keep your character intact you cannot stoop to filthy acts. It makes it easier to stoop the next time.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: Keep integrity and your work ethics intact. So what if that means working a little harder  an honorable character is your best calling card  and that's something anyone can have!
author: Kathy Ireland

quote: The world may take your reputation from you  but it cannot take your character.
author: Emma Dunham Kelley

quote: We must remember that one determined person can make a significant difference  and that a small group of determined people can change the course of history.
author: Sonia Johnson

quote: I am only one  but still I am one. I cannot do everything  but still I can do something. And because I cannot do everything I will not refuse to do the something that I can do.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Keep your promises to yourself.
author: David Harold Fink

quote: The possibilities are unlimited as long as you are true to your life's purpose.
author: Marcia Wieder

quote: Put your ear down close to your soul and listen hard.
author: Anne Sexton

quote: Like the winds of the sea are the ways of fate  As the voyage along thru life  'Tis the will of the soul That decides its goal  And not the calm or the strife.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: I believe there's an inner power that makes winners or losers. And the winners are the ones who really listen to the truth of their hearts.
author: Sylvester Stallone

quote: I was and I always shall be hampered by what I think other people will say.
author: Violette Leduc

quote: No matter how ill we may be  nor how low we may have fallen  we should not change identity with any other person.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Here I stand. I can do no other. God help me. Amen.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Whatever you want in life  other people are going to want it too. Believe in yourself enough to accept the idea that you have an equal right to it.
author: Diane Sawyer

quote: I argue that we deserve the choice to do whatever we want with our faces and bodies without being punished by an ideology that is using attitudes  economic pressure  and even legal judgments regarding women's appearance to undermine us psychologically and politically.
author: Naomi Wolf

quote: Nobody is so miserable as he who longs to be somebody other than the person he is.
author: Angelo Patri

quote: To be nobody-but-yourself-in a world which is doing its best  night and day  to make you everybody else-means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight  and never stop fighting.
author: e. e. cummings

quote: To aim at the best and to remain essentially ourselves is one and the same thing.
author: Janet Erskine Stuart

quote: We had as lief not be  as not be ourselves.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: No man can produce great things who is not thoroughly sincere in dealing with himself
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: The most exhausting thing in life is being insincere.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Man has no nobler function than to defend the truth.
author: Mahalia Jackson

quote: Every human being is intended to have a character of his own  to be what no others are  and to do what no other can do.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Do not wish to be anything but what you are.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

quote: I think God rarely gives to one man  or one set of men  more than one great moral victory to win.
author: Lucy Stone

quote: Truth has beauty  power  and necessity.
author: Sylvia Townsend Warner

quote: It is necessary to the happiness of man that he be mentally faithful to himself.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: Integrity simply means a willingness not to violate one's identity.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Don't compromise yourself. You are all you've got.
author: Janis Joplin

quote: The greatest thing in the world is to know how to be one's own self
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Theories are like scaffolding: they are not the house  but you cannot build the house without them.
author: Constance Fenimore Woolson

quote: To know what you prefer  instead of humbly saying "Amen" to what the world tells you you ought to prefer  is to keep your soul alive.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Do what thy manhood bids thee do.
author: Sir Richard Burton

quote: We live counterfeit lives in order to resemble the idea we first had of ourselves.
author: Andre Gide

quote: The moment that any life  however good  stifles you  you may be sure it isn't your real life.
author: Arthur Christopher Benson

quote: All is disgust when one leaves his own nature and does things that misfit it.
author: Sophocles

quote: What does reason demand of a man? A very easy thing-to live in accord with his own nature.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: We are sure to be losers when we quarrel with ourselves  it is civil war.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: With begging and scrambling we find very little  but with being true to ourselves we find a great deal more.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: While you cannot resolve what you are  at last you will be nothing.
author: Martial

quote: The highest courage is to dare to appear to be what one is.
author: John Lancaster Spalding

quote: Choose always the way that seems the best  however rough it may be  custom will soon render it easy and agreeable.
author: Pythagoras

quote: Our whole life is an attempt to discover when our spontaneity is whimsical  sentimental irresponsibility and when it is a valid expression of our deepest desires and values.
author: Helen Merrell Lynd

quote: Until you know that life is interesting  and find it so  you haven't found your soul.
author: Geoffrey Fisher

quote: It is better to be hated for what you are than loved for what you are not.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Learn what you are  and be such.
author: Pindar

quote: We are betrayed by what is false within.
author: George Meredith

quote: In the world to come they will not ask me  "Why were you not Moses?" They will ask me  "Why were you not Zusya?"
author: Zusya of Hanipoli

quote: A man must be obedient to the promptings of his innermost heart.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: All life is the struggle  the effort to be itself.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: What's a man's first duty? The answer is brief: To be himself.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: Any path is only a path  and there is no affront  to oneself or to others  in dropping it if that is what your heart tells you.
author: Carlos Castaneda

quote: It is possible to be different and still be all right.
author: Anne Wilson Schaef

quote: Let me listen to me and not to them.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: She lacks confidence  she craves admiration insatiably. She lives on the reflections of herself in the eyes of others. She does not dare to be herself.
author: Anais Nin

quote: I will not cut my conscience to fit this year's fashions.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: The crow that mimics a cormorant gets drowned.
author: Japanese proverb

quote: Let the world know you as you are  not as you think you should be  because sooner or later  if you are posing  you will forget the pose  and then where are you?
author: Fanny Brice

quote: I was raised to sense what someone wanted me to be and be that kind of person. It took me a long time not to judge myself through someone else's eyes.
author: Sally Field

quote: Education should be the process of helping everyone to discover his uniqueness.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Philosophy is a purely personal matter. A genuine philosopher's credo is the outcome of a single complex personality  it cannot be transferred. No two persons  if sincere  can have the same philosophy.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: Remember always that you have not only the right to be an individual  you have an obligation to be one.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: It is the chiefest point of happiness that a man is willing to be what he is.
author: Erasmus

quote: Follow what you love! Don't deign to ask what "they" are looking for out there. Ask what you have inside. Follow not your interests  which change  but what you are and what you love  which will and should not change.
author: Georgie Anne Geyer

quote: All the discontented people I know are trying to be something they are not  to do something they cannot do.
author: David Graydon

quote: Dress to please yourself.... Forget you are what you wear.... Wear what you are.
author: Elizabeth Hawkes

quote: Resolve to be thyself ... he who finds himself loses his misery!
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: If we do not rise to the challenge of our unique capacity to shape our lives  to seek the kinds of growth that we find individually fulfilling  then we can have no security: we will live in a world of sham  in which our selves are determined by the will of others  in which we will be constantly buffeted and increasingly isolated by the changes round us.
author: Nena O'Neil

quote: Happiness  that grand mistress of the ceremonies in the dance of life  impels us through all its mazes and meanderings  but leads none of us by the same route.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: A happy life is one which is in accordance with its own nature.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Different men seek after happiness in different ways and by different means  and so make for themselves different modes of life.
author: Aristotle

quote: All men have happiness as their object: there is no exception. However different the means they employ  they aim at the same end.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Be not imitator  freshly act thy part  Through this world be thou an independent ranger  Better is the faith that springeth from thy heart Than a better faith belonging to a stranger.
author: Persian proverb

quote: There is always a certain peace in being what one is  in being that completely.
author: Ugo Betti

quote: Posterity weaves no garlands for imitators.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: You have to deal with the fact that your life is your life.
author: Alex Haley

quote: I is who I is.
author: Tom Peterson

quote: There are as many ways to live and grow as there are people. Our own ways are the only ways that should matter to us.
author: Evelyn Mandel

quote: The white light streams down to be broken up by those human prisms into all the colors of the rainbow. Take your own color in the pattern and be just that.
author: Charles R. Brown

quote: The search for a new personality is futile  what is fruitful is the human interest the old personality can take in new activities.
author: Cesare Pavese

quote: We would have to settle for the elegant goal of becoming ourselves.
author: William Styron

quote: Our concern must be to live while we're alive ... to release our inner selves from the spiritual death that comes with living behind a facade designed to conform to external definitions of who and what we are.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: I searched through rebellion  drugs  diets  mysticism  religions  intellectu-alism and much more  only to begin to find ... that truth is basically simple-and feels good  clean and right.
author: Chick Corea

quote: If you're gonna be a failure  at least be one at something you enjoy.
author: Sylvester Stallone

quote: That suit is best that best suits me.
author: John Clark

quote: The self is not something that one finds. It is something one creates.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: Your readiest desire is your path to joy ... even if it destroys you.
author: Holbrook Jackson

quote: Individuals learn faster than institutions and it is always the dinosaur's brain that is the last to get the new messages.
author: Hazel Henderson

quote: Go ahead and do it. It's much easier to apologize after something's been done than to get permission ahead of time.
author: Grace Murray Hopper

quote: Innovators are inevitably controversial.
author: Eva Le Gallienne

quote: I'm not going to limit myself just because some people won't accept the fact that I can do something else.
author: Dolly Parton

quote: Criticism ... makes very little dent upon me  unless I think there is some real justification and something should be done.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: It is healthier  in any case  to write for the adults one's children will become than for the children one's "mature" critics often are.
author: Alice Walker

quote: I was the kind nobody thought could make it. I had a funny Boston accent. I couldn't pronounce my R's. I wasn't a beauty.
author: Barbara Walters

quote: Power is strength and the ability to see yourself through your own eyes and not through the eyes of another.
author: Agnes Whistling Elk

quote: Getting fit is a political act-you are taking charge of your life.
author: Jane Fonda

quote: I'm uncomfortable when I'm comfortable ... I can't help it  it's my personality.
author: Jay Chiat

quote: For a long time the only time I felt beautiful-in the sense of being complete as a woman  as a human being  and even female-was when I was singing.
author: Leontyne Price

quote: The source of continuing aliveness was to find your passion and pursue it  with whole heart and single mind.
author: Gail Sheehy

quote: I look at ordinary people in their suits  them with no scars  and I'm different. I don't fit with them. I'm where everybody's got scar tissue on their eyes and got noses like saddles. I go to conventions of old fighters like me and I see the scar tissue and all them flat noses and it's beautiful. ... They talk like me  like they got rocks in their throats. Beautiful!
author: Willie Pastrano

quote: I have the feeling when I write poetry that I'm doing what I'm supposed to do. You don't think about whether you're going to get money or fame  you just do it.
author: Doris Lund

quote: A door that seems to stand open must be of a man's size  or it is not the door that providence means for him.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: I have the true feeling of myself only when I am unbearably unhappy.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: Mountains should be climbed with as little effort as possible and without desire. The reality of your own nature should determine the speed. If you become restless  speed up. If you become winded  slow down. You climb the mountain in an equilibrium between restlessness and exhaustion. Then  when you're no longer thinking ahead  each footstep isn't just a means to an end  but a unique event in itself.
author: Robert M. Pirsig

quote: It is the soul's duty to be loyal to its own desires.
author: Rebecca West

quote: In the first grade  I already knew the pattern of my life. I didn't know the living of it  but I knew the line. ... From the first day in school until the day I graduated  everyone gave me one hundred plus in art. Well  where do you go in life? You go to the place where you got one hundred plus.
author: Louise Nevelson

quote: I am a writer because writing is the thing I do best.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: Each of us has some unique capability waiting for realization. Every person is valuable in his own existence  for himself alone ... each of us can bring to fruition these innate  God-given abilities.
author: George H. Bender

quote: All of us attain the greatest success and happiness possible in this life whenever we use our native capacities to their fullest extent. ... And every life must be chalked up at least a partial failure when it does not succeed in reaching its inherent destiny.
author: Smiley Blanton

quote: The same man cannot be skilled in everything  each has his special excellence.
author: Euripides

quote: Any talent that we are born with eventually surfaces as a need.
author: Marsha Sinetar

quote: The best career advice given to the young ... is "Find out what you like doing best and get someone to pay you for doing it."
author: Katharine Whitehorn

quote: Skills vary with the man. We must... strive by that which is born in us.
author: Pindar

quote: People are always neglecting something they can do in trying to do something they can't do.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: A man like Verdi must write like Verdi.
author: Giuseppe Verdi

quote: I write lustily and humorously. It isn't calculated  it's the way I think. I've invented a writing style that expresses who I am.
author: Erica Jong

quote: Each citizen should play his part in the community according to his individual gifts.
author: Plato

quote: Genius does what it must  talent does what it can.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Everything keeps its best nature only by being put to its best use.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: We don't see many fat men walking on stilts.
author: Bud Miller

quote: I was playing it like Willie Wilson  but I forgot that I'm in Clint Hurdle's body.
author: Clint Hurdle

quote: We succeed in enterprises which demand the positive qualities we possess  but we excel in those which can also make use of our defects.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: I wrote because I had to. I couldn't stop. There wasn't anything else I could do. If no one ever bought anything  anything I ever did  I'd still be writing. It's beyond a compulsion.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: If a man is called to be a streetsweep-er  he should sweep streets even as Michelangelo painted  or Beethoven composed music  or Shakespeare wrote poetry. He should sweep streets so well that all the hosts of heaven and earth will pause to say  here lived a great streetsweeper who did his job well.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Men whose trade is rat-catching  love to catch rats  the bug destroyer seizes on his bug with delight  and the suppressor is gratified by finding his vice.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Brutes find out where their talents lie  a bear will not attempt to fly.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: We may fail of our happiness  strive we ever so bravely  but we are less likely to fail if we measure with judgment our chances and our capabilities.
author: Agnes Repplier

quote: The greatest achievement of the human spirit is to live up to one's opportunities and make the most of one's resources.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: The test of a vocation is the love of the drudgery it involves.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Are you doing the kind of work you were built for  so that you can expect to be able to do very large amounts of that kind and thrive under it? Or are you doing a kind of which you can do comparatively little?
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: Starting out to make money is the greatest mistake in life. Do what you feel you have a flair for doing  and if you are good enough at it  the money will come.
author: Greer Garson

quote: Whenever it is possible  a boy should choose some occupation which he should do even if he did not need the money.
author: William Lyon Phelps

quote: The fun of being alive is realizing you have a talent and you can use it every day so it grows stronger.... And if you're in an atmosphere where this talent is appreciated instead of just tolerated  why  it's just as good as sex.
author: Lou Centlivre

quote: It is only when I am doing my work that I feel truly alive. It is like having sex.
author: Federico Fellini

quote: If a man has a talent and cannot use it  he has failed. If he has a talent and uses only half of it  he has partly failed. If he has a talent and learns somehow to use the whole of it  he has gloriously succeeded  and won a satisfaction and a triumph few men ever know.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: Everybody undertakes what he sees another successful in  whether he has the aptitude for it or not.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: To find out what one is fitted to do  and to secure an opportunity to do it  is the key to happiness.
author: John Dewey

quote: The road to happiness lies in two simple principles: find what interests you and that you can do well  and put your whole soul into it-every bit of energy and ambition and natural ability you have.
author: John D. Rockefeller III

quote: One should stick to the sort of thing for which one was made  I tried to be an herbalist  whereas I should keep to the butcher's trade.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: If you have to support yourself  you had bloody well better find some way that is going to be interesting.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: When men are rightfully occupied  then their amusement grows out of their work as the color petals out of a fruitful garden.
author: John Ruskin

quote: A musician must make music  an artist must paint  a poet must write  if he to be at peace with himself. What a man can be  he must be.
author: Abraham Maslow

quote: We do not write as we want but as we can.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Never desert your own line of talent. Be what nature intended you for  and you will succeed.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: It is not a dreamlike state  but the somehow insulated state  that a great musician achieves in a great performance. He's aware of where he is and what he's doing  but his mind is on the playing of his instrument with an internal sense of Tightness-it is not merely mechanical  it is not only spiritual  it is something of both  on a different plane and a more remote one.
author: Arnold Palmer

quote: We will discover the nature of our particular genius when we stop trying to conform to our own or to other people's models  learn to be ourselves  and allow our natural channel to open.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: It requires a certain kind of mind to see beauty in a hamburger bun. Yet  is it any more unusual to find grace in the texture and softly curved silhouette of a bun than to reflect lovingly on ... the arrangement of textures and colors in a butterfly's wing?
author: Ray Kroc

quote: The question "Who ought to be boss" is like asking "Who ought to be tenor in the quartet?" Obviously  the man who can sing tenor.
author: Henry Ford

quote: I'd rather be a failure at something I enjoy than a success at something I hate.
author: George Burns

quote: I cannot do everything  but still I can do something  and because I cannot do everything  I will not refuse to do the something that I can do.
author: Edward Everett Hale

quote: What really matters is what you do with what you have.
author: Shirley Lord

quote: I know that I haven't powers enough to divide myself into one who earns and one who creates.
author: Tillie Olsen

quote: Man is not born to solve the problems of the universe  but to find out what he has to do ... within the limits of his comprehension.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: The weakest among us has a gift  however seemingly trivial  which is peculiar to him and which worthily used will be a gift also to his race.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Every person is responsible for all the good within the scope of his abilities  and for no more.
author: Gail Hamilton

quote: Me  I'm just a hack. I'm just a schlep-per. I just do what I can do.
author: Bette Midler

quote: The great law of culture: Let each become all that he was created capable of being.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Don't bother just to be better than your contemporaries or predecessors. Try to be better than yourself.
author: William Faulkner

quote: God requires a faithful fulfillment of the merest trifle given us to do  rather than the most ardent aspiration to things to which we are not called.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

quote: When I was young  I said to God  "God  tell me the mystery of the universe." But God answered  "That knowledge is reserved for me alone." So I said  "God  tell me the mystery of the peanut." Then God said  "Well George  that's more nearly your size." And he told me.
author: George Washington Carver

quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task  but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
author: Helen Keller

quote: We may fail of our happiness  strive we ever so bravely  but we are less likely to fail if we measure with judgment our chances and our capabilities.
author: Agnes Repplier

quote: No amount of study or learning will make a man a leader unless he has the natural qualities of one.
author: Sir Archibald Wavell

quote: Choose a subject equal to your abilities  think carefully what your shoulders may refuse  and what they are capable of bearing.
author: Horace

quote: In efforts to soar above our nature  we invariably fall below it.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: The driver knows how much the ox can carry  and keeps the ox from being overloaded. You know your way and your state of mind. Do not carry too much.
author: Zen saying

quote: If you could once make up your mind never to undertake more work ... than you can carry on calmly  quietly  without hurry or flurry ... and if the instant you feel yourself growing nervous and ... out of breath  you would stop and take breath  you would find this simple common-sense rule doing for you what no prayers or tears could ever accomplish.
author: Elizabeth Prentiss

quote: The deepest personal defeat suffered by human beings is constituted by the difference between what one was capable of becoming  and what one has in fact become.
author: Ashley Montagu

quote: What I wanted was to be allowed to do the thing in the world that I did best-which I believed then and believe now is the greatest privilege there is. When I did that  success found me.
author: Debbi Fields

quote: I had already learned from more than a decade of political life that I was going to be criticized no matter what I did  so I might as well be criticized for something I wanted to do.
author: Rosalynn Carter

quote: There is only one success-to be able to spend your life in your own way.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: The only success worth one's powder was success in the line of one's idiosyncrasy ... what was talent but the art of being completely whatever one happened to be?
author: Henry James

quote: We are traditionally rather proud of ourselves for having slipped creative work in there between the domestic chores and obligations. I'm not sure we deserve such big A-pluses for all that.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: Success based on anything but internal fulfillment is bound to be empty.
author: Dr. Martha Friedman

quote: We succeed in enterprises which demand the positive qualities we possess  but we excel in those which can also make use of our defects.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: All I would tell people is to hold on to what was individual about themselves  not to allow their ambition for success to cause them to try to imitate the success of others. You've got to find in on your own terms.
author: Harrison Ford

quote: For me  writing is the only thing that passes the three tests of metier: (i) when I'm doing it  I don't feel that I should be doing something else instead  (2) it produces a sense of accomplishment and  once in a while  pride  and (3) it's frightening.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: One can never consent to creep when one feels an impulse to soar.
author: Helen Keller

quote: My mother said to me  "If you become a soldier  you'll be a general  if you become a monk you'll end up as the pope." Instead  I became a painter and wound up as Picasso.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: We only do well the things we like doing.
author: Colette

quote: Abasement  degradation is simply the manner of life of the man who has refused to be what it is his duty to be.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: A first rate soup is better than a second rate painting.
author: Abraham Maslow

quote: We can't all be heroes  because someone has to sit on the curb and clap as they go by.
author: Will Rogers

quote: I'd rather be a lamppost in Chicago than a millionaire in any other city.
author: William A. Hulbert

quote: Whatever you are by nature  keep to it  never desert your own line of talent. Be what nature intended you for  and you will succeed  be anything else and you will be ten thousand times worse than nothing.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Ask yourself the secret of your success. Listen to your answer  and practice it.
author: Richard Bach

quote: Do what you love  the money will follow.
author: Marsha Sinetar

quote: I am only one  but still I am one. I cannot do everything  but still I can do something  and because I cannot do everything  I will not refuse to do something I can do.
author: Edward Everett Hale

quote: Starting out to make money is the greatest mistake in life. Do what you feel you have a flair for doing  and if you are good enough at it  the money will come.
author: Greer Garson

quote: If a man has a talent and cannot use it  he has failed. If he has a talent and uses only half of it  he has partly failed. If he has a talent and learns somehow to use the whole of it  he has gloriously succeeded  and won a satisfaction and a triumph few men ever know.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: A man can do only what he can do. But if he does that each day he can sleep at night and do it again the next day.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Don't take anyone else's definition of success as your own. (This is easier said than done.)
author: Jacqueline Briskin

quote: You must be holy in the way God asks you to be holy. God does not ask you to be a Trappist monk or a hermit. He wills that you sanctify your everyday life.
author: Saint Vincent Pallotti

quote: The first duty of a human being is to assume the right relationship to society-more briefly  to find your real job  and do it.
author: Charlotte P. Gilman

quote: The great enemy of clear language is insincerity. When there is a gap between one's real and one's declared aims  one turns  as it were  instinctively to long words and exhausted idioms  like a cuttlefish squirting out ink.
author: George Orwell

quote: We don't know who we are until we see what we can do.
author: Martha Grimes

quote: If Heaven made him  earth can find some use for him.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Don't do anything that someone else can do for you because there are only so many things that only you can do.
author: Jinger Heath

quote: The hole and the patch should be commensurate.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The things that one most wants to do are the things that are probably most worth doing.
author: Winifred Holtby

quote: If all misfortunes were laid in one common heap whence everyone must take an equal portion  most people would be contented to take their own and depart.
author: Socrates

quote: Every true man  sir  who is a little above the level of the beasts and plants  lives so as to give a meaning and a value to his own life.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: Sir  I would rather be right than be President.
author: Henry Clay

quote: He will hew to the line of right  let the chips fly where they may.
author: Roscoe Conkling

quote: Be sure you are right  then go ahead.
author: David Crockett

quote: Two wrongs can never make a right.
author: English proverb

quote: Let us have faith that Right makes Might  and in that faith let us to the end dare to do our duty as we understand it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Right is the eternal sun  the world cannot delay its coming.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: One truth is clear  Whatever is is right.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Heaven itself has ordained the right.
author: George Washington

quote: Wherever there is a human being  I see God-given rights inherent in that being  whatever may be the sex or complexion.
author: William Lloyd Garrison

quote: The equal right of all men to the use of land is as clear as their equal right to breathe the air - it is a right proclaimed by the fact of their existence. For we cannot suppose that some men have a right to be in this world  and others no right.
author: Henry George

quote: Equal rights for all  special privileges for none.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: You risk just as much in being credulous as in being suspicious.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: Our whole way of life today is dedicated to the removal of risk. Cradle to grave we are supported  insulated  and isolated from the risks of life- and if we fall  our government stands ready with Band-Aids of every size.
author: Shirley Temple Black

quote: Any life truly lived is a risky business  and if one puts up too many fences against the risks one ends by shutting out life itself.
author: Kenneth S. Davis

quote: However well organized the foundations of life may be  life must always be full of risks.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: Dancing on the edge is the only place to be.
author: Trisha Brown

quote: It is so tempting to try the most difficult thing possible.
author: Jennie Jerome Churchill

quote: All life is a chance. So take it! The person who goes furthest is the one who is willing to do and dare.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: I postpone death by living  by suffering  by error  by risking  by giving  by losing.
author: Anais Nin

quote: If you don't take chances  you can't do anything in life.
author: Michael Spinks

quote: Only those who dare  truly live.
author: Ruth P. Freedman

quote: Life has no romance without risk.
author: Sarah Doherty

quote: We love because it is the only true adventure.
author: Nikki Giovanni

quote: If your life is ever going to get better  you'll have to take risks. There is simply no way you can grow without taking chances.
author: David Viscott

quote: You've got to keep fighting-you've got to risk your life every six months to stay alive.
author: Elia Kazan

quote: It takes courage to lead a life. Any life.
author: Erica Jong

quote: There's no such thing as a sure thing. That's why they call it gambling.
author: Neil Simon

quote: It is only by risking ... that we live at all.
author: William James

quote: Life is a risk.
author: Diane von Furstenberg

quote: To be alive at all involves some risk.
author: Harold Macmillan

quote: This nation was built by men who took risks-pioneers who were not afraid of the wilderness  business men who were not afraid of failure  scientists who were not afraid of the truth  thinkers who were not afraid of progress  dreamers who were not afraid of action.
author: Brooks Atkinson

quote: To live without risk for me would be tantamount to death.
author: Jacqueline Cochran

quote: It is the business of the future to be dangerous.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: To achieve anything  you must be prepared to dabble on the boundary of disaster.
author: Stirling Moss

quote: He that will not sail till all dangers are over must never put to sea.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: The fishermen know that the sea is dangerous and the storm terrible  but they have never found these dangers sufficient reason for remaining ashore.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: If we are intended for great ends  we are called to great hazards.
author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

quote: Liberty is always dangerous  but it is the safest thing we have.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: One never finds anything perfectly pure and ... exempt from danger.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: A sharp knife cuts the quickest and hurts the least.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: It's only when we have nothing else to hold onto that we're willing to try something very audacious and scary.
author: Sonia Johnson

quote: Constant exposure to dangers will breed contempt for them.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. The fearful are caught as often as the bold.
author: Helen Keller

quote: All reformations seem formidable before they are attempted.
author: Hannah Moore

quote: What one has not experienced  one will never understand in print.
author: Isadora Duncan

quote: Doing is a quantum leap from imagining.
author: Barbara Sher

quote: It is not manly to turn one's back on fortune.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Be bold  and mighty forces will come to your aid.
author: Basil King

quote: A leader must face danger. He must take the risk and the blame  and the brunt of the storm.
author: Herbert N. Casson

quote: Fortune and love befriend the bold.
author: Ovid

quote: Our safety is not in blindness  but in facing our danger.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: Of course people are afraid. But honestly facing that fear  seeing it for what it is  is the only way of putting it to rest.
author: Harvey Fierstein

quote: Unless you enter the tiger's den  you cannot take the cubs.
author: Japanese proverb

quote: All work of man is as the swimmer's: a vast ocean threatens to devour him  if he front it not bravely  it will keep its word.
