quote: Felicity  felicity ... is quaffed out of a golden cup ... the flavour is with you alone  and you can make it as intoxicating as you please.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: To be obliged to beg our daily happiness from others bespeaks a more lamentable poverty than that of him who begs his daily bread.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: To wait for someone else  or to expect someone else to make my life richer  or fuller  or more satisfying  puts me in a constant state of suspension.
author: Kathleen Tierney Andrus

quote: I am my own heaven and hell!
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: I am responsible for my own well-being  my own happiness. The choices and decisions I make regarding my life directly influence the quality of my days.
author: Kathleen Tierney Andrus

quote: If you do not find peace in yourself you will never find it anywhere else.
author: Paula A. Bendry

quote: To know what you prefer  instead of humbly saying Amen to what the world tells you that you ought to prefer  is to have kept your soul alive.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: If people are suffering  then they must look within themselves. ... Happiness is not something ready-made [Buddha] can give you. It comes from your own actions.
author: The Dalai Lama

quote: Blame yourself if you have no branches or leaves  don't accuse the sun of partiality.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: The opportunities for enjoyment in your life are limitless. If you feel you are not experiencing enough joy  you have only yourself to blame.
author: David E. Bresler

quote: Happiness is like time and space-we make and measure it ourselves  it is as fancy  as big  as little  as you please  just a thing of contrasts and comparisons.
author: George Du Maurier

quote: It is not easy to find happiness in ourselves  and it is not possible to find it elsewhere.
author: Agnes Repplier

quote: The greatest griefs are those we cause ourselves.
author: Sophocles

quote: No human being can really understand another  and no one can arrange another's happiness.
author: Graham Greene

quote: No-one gives joy or sorrow. ... We gather the consequences of our own deeds.
author: Garuda Purana

quote: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

quote: The amount of satisfaction you get from life depends largely on your own ingenuity  self-sufficiency  and resourcefulness. People who wait around for life to supply their satisfaction usually find boredom instead.
author: Dr. William Menninger

quote: Somebody's boring me  I think it's me.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: Being bored is an insult to oneself.
author: Jules Renard

quote: When people are bored  it is primarily with their own selves that they are bored.
author: Jules Renard

quote: If your daily life seems poor  do not blame it  blame yourself  tell yourself that you are not poet enough to call forth its riches.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Life's under no obligation to give us what we expect.
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: One has to handle these negative experiences alone. You can't get help from your friends or family. You're finally alone with it  and you have to come to grips with misfortune and go on.
author: Shirley Temple Black

quote: Expect nothing. Live frugally on surprise.
author: Alice Walker

quote: If you want to succeed  you must make your own opportunities as you go.
author: John B. Gough

quote: It is sometimes the man who opens the door who is the last to enter the room.
author: Elizabeth Asquith Bibesco

quote: If  after all  men cannot always make history have a meaning  they can always act so that their own lives have one.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Every man is the architect of his own fortune.
author: Sallust

quote: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Man is still responsible. ... His success lies not with the stars  but with himself. He must carry on the fight of self-correction and discipline.
author: Frank Curtis Williams

quote: No one can help you in holding a good job except Old Man You.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: No man will succeed unless he is ready to face and overcome difficulties and prepared to assume responsibilities.
author: William J. H. Boetcker

quote: The brave man carves out his fortune  and every man is the sum of his own works.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Under normal periods  any man's success hinges about 5 percent on what others do for him and 95 percent on what he does.
author: James A. Worsham

quote: Pa  he always said a man had to look spry for himself  because nobody would do it for him  your opportunities didn't come knocking around  you had to hunt them down and hog-tie them.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Destiny is not a matter of chance  it is a matter of choice  it is not a thing to be waited for  it is a thing to be achieved.
author: William Jennings Bryan

quote: Mistakes fail in their mission of helping the person who blames them on the other fellow.
author: Henry S. Haskins

quote: We have not passed that subtle line between childhood and adulthood until... we have stopped saying "It got lost " and say "I lost it."
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: Do not blame anybody for your mistakes and failures.
author: Bernard M. Baruch

quote: The day you take complete responsibility for yourself  the day you stop making excuses  that's the day you start your move to the top.
author: O. J. Simpson

quote: It is a painful thing to look at your own trouble and know that you yourself  and no one else  has made it.
author: Sophocles

quote: Take your life in your own hands  and what happens? A terrible thing: no one to blame.
author: Erica Jong

quote: What fate can be worse than to know we have no one but ourselves to blame for our misfortunes!
author: Sophocles

quote: Fair play with others is primarily not blaming them for anything that is wrong with us.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: How we love to blame others for our misfortunes! Almost every individual who has lost money in stock speculation has on the tip of his tongue an explanation which he trots out to show that it wasn't his own fault at all.... Hardly one loser has the manliness to say frankly  "I was wrong."
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: Man must cease attributing his problems to his environment and learn again to exercise ... his personal responsibility in the realm of faith and morals.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: The greatest griefs are those we cause ourselves.
author: Sophocles

quote: A chief is a man who assumes responsibility. He does not say  "My men were beaten " he says  "I was beaten."
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Debt is a trap which man sets and baits himself  and then deliberately gets into.
author: Josh Billings

quote: God helps those who help themselves.
author: German proverb

quote: I feel no need for any other faith than my faith in human beings.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: It is vain to ask of the gods what man is capable of supplying for himself.
author: Epicurus

quote: The gods help those who help themselves.
author: Marcus Terentius Varro

quote: Ask God's blessing on your work  but don't ask him to do it for you.
author: Dame Flora Robson

quote: He who prays and labours lifts his heart to God with his hands.

quote: God gives every bird its food  but he does not throw it into the nest.
author: Josiah G. Holland

quote: Trust in Allah  but tie your camel first.
author: Arab proverb

quote: Put your trust in God  my boys  and keep your powder dry!
author: Valentine Blacker

quote: God loves to help him who strives to help himself.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Religious faith  indeed  relates to that which is above us  but it must arise from that which is within us.
author: Josiah Royce

quote: Even God lends a hand to honest boldness.
author: Menander

quote: Help yourself and heaven will help you.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: God has entrusted me with myself.
author: Epictetus

quote: The Ancient Mariner said to Neptune during a great storm  "O God  you will save me if you wish  but I am going to go on holding my tiller straight."

quote: If your ship doesn't come in  swim out to it.

quote: To character and success  two things  contradictory as they may seem  must go together-humble dependence and manly independence  humble dependence on God and manly reliance on self.

quote: I am a moonbeam  free to go whenever I choose.

quote: My will shall shape my future. Whether I fail or succeed shall be no man's doing but my own. I am the force  I can clear any obstacle before me or I can be lost in the maze. My choice  my responsibility  win or lose  only I hold the key to my destiny.

quote: I had never been as resigned to ready-made ideas as I was to ready-made clothes  perhaps because although I couldn't sew  I could think.
author: Jane Rule

quote: Self-reliance is the only road to true freedom  and being one's own person is its ultimate reward.
author: Patricia Sampson

quote: The basic freedom of the world is woman's freedom.
author: Margaret Sanger

quote: Never grow a wishbone  daughter  where your backbone ought to be.
author: Clementine Paddleford

quote: You are the handicap you must face. You are the one who must choose your place.
author: James Lane Allen

quote: The best and most efficient pharmacy is within your own system.

quote: I am the master of my fate  I am the captain of my soul.
author: William E. Henley

quote: Champions take responsibility. When the ball is coming over the net  you can be sure I want the ball.
author: Billie Jean King

quote: A man is a lion in his own cause.
author: Scottish proverb

quote: For they can conquer who believe they can.

quote: I have ever held it as a maxim never to do that through another which it was possible for me to execute myself.

quote: Doubt whom you will  but never yourself.

quote: No man should part with his own individuality and become that of another.

quote: Think wrongly  if you please  but in all cases think for yourself.

quote: Then out spake brave Horatius  The captain of the gate: "To every man upon this earth Death cometh soon or late. And how can man die better Than facing fearful odds  For the ashes of his fathers And the temples of his gods?"
author: Macaulay

quote: The force of selfishness is as inevitable and as calculable as the force of gravitation.
author: Hailliard

quote: The same people who can deny others everything are famous for refusing themselves nothing.
author: Leigh Hunt

quote: That man who lives for self alone Lives for the meanest mortal known.

quote: Selfishness is the only real atheism  aspiration  unselfishness  the only real religion.

quote: They also serve who only stand and wait.
author: John Milton

quote: Servant of God  well done.
author: John Milton

quote: They serve God well  Who serve his creatures.
author: Caroline Norton

quote: He profits most who serves best.
author: Arthur F. Sheldon

quote: I'll wager that in ten years it will be fashionable again to be a virgin.
author: Barbara Cartland

quote: Is sex dirty? Only if it is done right.
author: Woody Allen

quote: It may be the cock that crows  but it is the hen that lays the eggs.

quote: Sara could commit adultery at one end and weep for her sins at the other  and enjoy both operations at once.

quote: Sex is an emotion in motion.

quote: Sex is a relatively recent addition to the dance of life. For more than 2 000 000 000 years  asexual reproduction was the rule. You know  if you were a creature  you just separated into two clones.

quote: Sex  unlike justice  should not be seen to be done.

quote: The reason that husbands and wives do not understand each other is because they belong to different sexes.

quote: There will be sex after death  we just won't be able to feel it.

quote: Two-parent sex appeared on the scene about 500 000 000 years ago.

quote: When she raises her eyelids it's as if she were taking off all her clothes.

quote: Sex is the great amateur art.

quote: Of all sexual aberrations  perhaps the most peculiar is chastity.

quote: Whatever else can be said about sex  it cannot be called a dignified performance.

quote: Sex - the poor man's polo.

quote: Lord  make me chaste - but not yet.

quote: The natural man has only two primal passions - to get and beget.

quote: Amoebas at the start were not complex -They tore themselves apart and started sex.

quote: Every animal is sad after intercourse.

quote: As a matter of biology  if something bites you it is probably female.

quote: Sex ought to be a wholly satisfying link between two affectionate people from which they emerge unanxious  rewarded  and ready for more.

quote: When a man tells me he's run out of steam in the sex department  I'll tell him  'Count your blessings  you've escaped from the clutches of a cruel tyrant. Enjoy!'

quote: While a person does not give up on sex  sex does not give up on the person.

quote: I wasn't kissing her. I was whispering in her mouth.

quote: All men look at Dr. Ruth and wonder how she has gained all that sexual experience.

quote: Is sex dirty? Only if it's done right.

quote: Girls are much more psychic than guys. They're the first to know if you're going to get laid.

quote: Sex at eighty-four is terrific  especially the one in the winter.

quote: In opposition to sex education: Let the kids today learn it where we did - in the gutter.

quote: Sex is one of the nine reasons for reincarnation. The other eight are unimportant.

quote: I am always looking for meaningful one-night stands.

quote: I'm at the age when food has taken the place of sex in my life. In fact  I've just had a mirror put over my kitchen table.

quote: I was with this girl the other night  and from the way she was responding to my skillful caresses  you would have sworn she was conscious from the top of her head to the tag on her toes.

quote: If there is reincarnation  I'd like to come back as Warren Beatty's fingertips.

quote: There are a number of mechanical devices which increase sexual arousal  particularly in women. Chief among these is the Mercedes-Benz 380 SL convertible.

quote: What shadows we are  what shadows we pursue!

quote: Coming events cast their shadows before.

quote: Shadows are in reality  when the sun is shining  the most conspicuous thing in a landscape  next to the highest lights.

quote: He was not of an age  but for all time!

quote: Shakespeare has had neither equal nor second.
author: Macaulay

quote: Shame is an ornament to the young  a disgrace to the old.

quote: I count him lost  who is lost to shame.
author: Plautus

quote: A leap year Is never a good sheep year.

quote: One for the master  And one for my dame  And one for the little boy Who lives in the lane.
author: Nursery Rhyme

quote: Don't give up the ship!
author: James Lawrence

quote: Ships that pass in the night.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: There breaks in every Gloucester wave A windowed woman's heart.
author: Elizabeth Ward

quote: Him that makes shoes go barefoot himself.
author: Henry Burton

quote: I can tell where my own shoe pinches me.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Sickness is a belief  which must be annihilated by the divine Mind.

quote: Prevention is better than cure.

quote: How could the drops of water know themselves to be a river? Yet the river flows on.

quote: Silence is as full of potential wisdom and wit as the unhewn marble of great sculpture.

quote: The silent dog is the first to bite.

quote: We need a reason to speak  but none to keep silent.

quote: Silence is the unbearable repartee.

quote: That man's silence is wonderful to listen to.

quote: He has the gift of quiet.

quote: I'm exhausted from not talking.

quote: The cruellest lies are often told in silence.

quote: Nature has given to men one tongue  but two ears  that we may hear from others twice as much as we speak.

quote: Speech may be barren  but it is ridiculous to suppose that silence is always brooding on a nestful of eggs.

quote: The most silent people are generally those who think most highly of themselves.

quote: The greatest triumphs of propaganda have been accomplished  not by doing something  but by refraining from doing. Great is truth  but still greater  from a practical point of view  is silence about truth.

quote: Men fear silence as they fear solitude  because both give them a glimpse of the terror of life's nothingness.

quote: Silence is deep as Eternity  speech  shallow as Time.

quote: Better silent than stupid.

quote: It is a great misfortune neither to have enough wit to talk well nor enough judgement to be silent.

quote: I have noticed that nothing I never said ever did me any harm.

quote: One of the best ways to persuade others is with your ears.

quote: It is easier to talk than to hold one's tongue.
author: Greek proverb

quote: Silence is more eloquent than words.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Silence is the unbearable repartee.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Speech is silver  silence is golden.
author: German proverb

quote: Still waters run deep.
author: English proverb

quote: Vessels never give so great a sound as when they are empty.

quote: It is a great misfortune neither to have enough wit to talk well nor enough judgment to be silent.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Keep quiet and people will think you a philosopher.

quote: Blessed are they who have nothing to say  and who cannot be persuaded to say it.

quote: Be silent and safe - silence never betrays you.

quote: I regret often that I have spoken  never that I have been silent.

quote: A speech does not need to be eternal to be immortal.

quote: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.

quote: It helped me in the air to keep my small mind contained in earthly human limits  not lost in vertiginous space and elements unknown.

quote: A man must be able to cut a knot  for everything cannot be untied  he must know how to disengage what is essential from the detail in which it is enwrapped  for everything cannot be equally considered  in a word  he must be able to simplify his duties  his business and his life.

quote: Simplicity is an exact medium between too little and too much.

quote: Simplicity and naturalness are the truest marks of distinction.

quote: Everything should be made as simple as possible ... but not simpler.

quote: To be simple is the best thing in the world.

quote: If we live  we live  if we die  we die  if we suffer  we suffer  if we are terrified  we are terrified. There is no problem about it.

quote: I have a simple philosophy. Fill what's empty. Empty what's full. And scratch where it itches.

quote: Keep breathing.

quote: I go about looking at horses and cattle. They eat grass  make love  work when they have to  bear their young. I am sick with envy of them.

quote: What you do not want done to yourself  do not do to others.

quote: I know only that what is moral is what you feel good after and what is immoral is what you feel bad after.

quote: My formula for living is quite simple. I get up in the morning and I go to bed at night. In between I occupy myself as best I can.

quote: Life is one long struggle to disinter oneself  to keep one's head above the accumulations  the ever deepening layers of objects ... which attempt to cover one over  steadily  almost irresistibly  like falling snow.

quote: Is nothing in life ever straight and clear  the way children see it?

quote: There is no cure for birth or death save to enjoy the interval.

quote: We cannot solve life's problems except by solving them.

quote: Eat when you're hungry. Drink when you're thirsty. Sleep when you're tired.
author: Buddhist proverb

quote: I believe that a simple and unassuming manner of life is best for everyone  best both for the body and the mind.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: If it's working  keep doing it. If it's not working  stop doing it. If you don't know what to do  don't do anything.

quote: If you don't like something about yourself  change it. If you can't change it  accept it.

quote: There is only one meaning of life  the act of living itself.

quote: I have a simple philosophy. Fill what's empty. Empty what's full. Scratch where it itches.

quote: The boy and girl going hand in hand through a meadow  the mother washing her baby  the sweet simple things in life. We have almost lost track of them. On the one side  we overintel-lectualize everything  on the other hand  we are over-mechanized. We can understand the danger of the atomic bomb  but the danger of our misunderstanding the meaning of life is much more serious.

quote: Fear less  hope more  eat less  chew more  whine less  breathe more  talk less  say more  love more  and all good things will be yours.

quote: I take a simple view of living. It is  keep your eyes open and get on with it.

quote: Love  and do what you like.

quote: Fame is a pearl many dive for and only a few bring up. Even when they do  it is not perfect  and they sigh for more  and lose better things in struggling for them.

quote: God made man simple  but how he changed and got complicated is hard to say.

quote: The man of fixed ingrained principles who has mapped out a straight course  and has the courage and self-control to adhere to it  does not find life complex. Complexities are all of our own making.

quote: The whole is simpler than the sum of its parts.

quote: The course of every intellectual  if he pursues his journey long and unflinchingly enough  ends in the obvious  from which the non-intellectuals have never stirred.

quote: Any intelligent fool can make things bigger  more complex  and more violent. It takes a touch of genius-and a lot of courage-to move in the opposite direction.

quote: At times almost all of us envy the animals. They suffer and die  but do not seem to make a "problem" of it.

quote: First say to yourself what you would be  and then do what you have to do.

quote: You decide what it is you want to accomplish and then you lay out your plans to get there  and then you just do it. It's pretty straightforward.

quote: There is a point at which everything becomes simple and there is no longer any question of choice  because all you have staked will be lost if you look back. Life's point of no return.

quote: The sculptor produces the beautiful statue by chipping away such parts of the marble block as are not needed- it is a process of elimination.

quote: A great man is one who seizes the vital issue in a complex question  what we might call the jugular vein of the whole organism  and spends his energies upon that.

quote: The more we reduce the size of our world  the more we shall be its master.

quote: There is no greatness where there is not simplicity.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of nonessentials.

quote: All animals except man know that the ultimate of life is to enjoy it.

quote: I finally figured out the only reason to be alive is to enjoy it.

quote: Happiness comes of the capacity to feel deeply  to enjoy simply  to think freely  to risk life  to be needed.

quote: The main obligation is to amuse yourself.
author: S. J. Perelman

quote: There is no cure for birth or death save to enjoy the interval.
author: George Santayana

quote: Success is simple. Do what's right  the right way  at the right time.

quote: There is a master key to success with which no man can fail. Its name is simplicity ... reducing to the simplest possible terms every problem.

quote: If you want to be found  stand where the seeker seeks.

quote: Many things are lost for want of asking.

quote: Economy  prudence  and a simple life are the sure masters of need  and will often accomplish that which their opposites  with a fortune at hand  will fail to do.

quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions but in having few wants.

quote: If you aren't going all the way  why go at all?

quote: Players have two things to do: Play and keep their mouths shut.

quote: All I had to do was keep turning left.

quote: If you don't throw it  they can't hit it.

quote: It's a round ball and a round bat  and you got to hit it square.
author: Pete Rose

quote: There are only five things you can do in baseball: run  throw  catch  hit  and hit with power.

quote: Losers have tons of variety. Champions take pride in just learning to hit the same old boring winners.

quote: Don't let go of the vine.

quote: Stay out of jail.

quote: In combat  life is short  nasty and brutish. The issues of national policy which brought him into war are irrelevant to the combat soldier  he is concerned with his literal life chances.

quote: You don't hurt 'em if you don't hit 'em.

quote: There is nothing certain about war except that one side won't win.

quote: I can always make it a rule to get there first with the most men.

quote: The object of war is not to die for your country  but to make the other bastard die for his.

quote: The object of war is to survive it.

quote: When ideas come  I write them  when they don't come  I don't.

quote: The idea is to get the pencil moving quickly.

quote: I never thought of myself as a writer  but the simplest thing seemed to be to put a piece of paper in the roller and start typing.

quote: The niftiest turn of phrase  the most elegant flight of rhetorical fancy  isn't worth beans next to a clear thought clearly expressed.

quote: Get black on white.

quote: Art  it seems to me  should simplify.

quote: It's a simple formula  do your best and somebody might like it.

quote: Simplicity  carried to an extreme  becomes elegance.

quote: When an idea is too weak to support a simple statement  it is a sign that it should be rejected.

quote: When thought is too weak to be simply expressed  it's clear proof that it should be rejected.

quote: The great artist and thinker are the simplifiers.

quote: Simple truths are a relief from grand speculations.

quote: Simplicity of character is the natural result of profound thought.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Affected simplicity is refined imposture.

quote: The fewer our wants  the nearer we resemble the gods.

quote: O sin  what hast thou done to this fair earth!

quote: He that falls into sin is a man  that grieves at it  is a saint  that boasteth of it  is a devil.

quote: Proverty and wealth are comparative sins.

quote: The sin they do by two and two they must pay for one by one.

quote: So many laws argue so many sins.

quote: It is not alone what we do  but also what we do not do  for which we are accountable.

quote: In Adam's Fall We sinned all.

quote: 0 thou  who didst with pitfall and with gin Beset the road I was to wander in  Thou wilt not with predestin'd evil round Enmesh  and then impute my fall to sin.

quote: The wages of sin-is death.
author: Romans

quote: Of all the evil spirits abroad at this hour in the world  insincerity is the most dangerous.
author: James Froude

quote: There is no greater delight than to be conscious of sincerity on self-examination.

quote: Skepticism means  not intellectual doubt alone  but moral doubt.

quote: With most people  doubt about one thing is simply blind belief in another.

quote: Skeptics are never deceived.

quote: I am ready to reject all belief and reasoning  and can look upon no opinion even as more probable or likely than another.

quote: Believe nothing and be on your guard against everything.

quote: And that inverted Bowl they call the Sky  Whereunder crawling coop'd we live and die  Lift not your hands to it for help - for it As impotently moves as you or I.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: Sometimes gentle  sometimes capricious  sometimes awful  never the same for two moments together  almost human in its passions  almost spiritual in its tenderness  almost Divine in its infinity.

quote: A slander is like a hornet  if you cannot kill it dead the first blow  better not strike at it.

quote: If slander be a snake  it is a winged one - it flies as well as creeps.

quote: The compact which exists between the North and the South is a covenant with death and an agreement with hell  involving both parties in atrocious criminality and should be immediately annulled.

quote: I believe this government cannot endure permanently half slave and half free.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Corrupted freemen are the worst slaves.
author: David Garrick

quote: The man who gives me employment  which I must have or suffer  that man is my master  let me call him what I will.
author: Henry George

quote: They are slaves who fear to speak For the fallen and the weak  They are slaves who dare not be In the right with two or three.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: They (the blacks) had no right which the white man was bound to respect.
author: Roger B. Taney

quote: The feeling of sleepiness when you are not in bed  and can't get there  is the meanest feeling in the world.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Did anyone ever have a boring dream?
author: Ralph Hodgson

quote: Over my slumber your loving watch keep -  Rock me to sleep  mother  rock me to sleep.
author: Elizabeth Akers Allen

quote: Fatigue is the best pillow.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Sleep is the best cure for waking troubles.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: One hour's sleep before midnight is worth three after.
author: George Herbert

quote: Soft closer of our eyes! Low murmur of tender lullabies!
author: John Keats

quote: Sleep  rest of nature  O sleep  most gentle of the divinities  peace of the soul  thou at whose presence care disappears  who soothest hearts wearied with daily employments  and makest them strong again for labour!
author: Ovid

quote: I never sleep comfortably except when I am at sermon or when I pray to God.
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: To all  to each  a fair goodnight  And pleasing dreams  and slumbers light.
author: Walter Scott

quote: She slept the sleep of the just.
author: Racine

quote: Hush  my dear  lie still and slumber! Holy angels guard they bed! Heavenly blessings without number Gently falling on thy head.
author: Isaac Watts

quote: I've had a lot of experience with people smarter than I am.
author: Gerald Ford

quote: After pleasant scratching comes unpleasant smarting.
author: Danish proverb

quote: I am not the smartest or most talented person in the world  but I succeeded because I keep going  and going  and going.
author: Sylvester Stallone

quote: Cats are smarter than dogs. You can't get eight cats to pull a sled through snow.
author: Jeff Valdez

quote: I've had a lot of experience with people smarter than I am.
author: Gerald Ford

quote: After pleasant scratching comes unpleasant smarting.
author: Danish proverb

quote: I am not the smartest or most talented person in the world  but I succeeded because I keep going  and going  and going.
author: Sylvester Stallone

quote: Cats are smarter than dogs. You can't get eight cats to pull a sled through snow.
author: Jeff Valdez

quote: Smiles form the channels of a future tear.
author: Lord Byron

quote: 'Tis easy enough to be pleasant  When life flows along like a song  But the man worth while is the one who will smile When everything goes dead wrong.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: What's the use of worrying? It never was worth while  so Pack up your troubles in your old kit-bag  And smile  smile  smile.
author: George Asaf

quote: It's full of worth and goodness too  with manly kindness blent  It's worth a million dollars and it doesn't cost a cent.
author: Wilbur D. Nesbit

quote: Who can refute a sneer?
author: William Paley

quote: It is just as hard to do your duty when men are sneering at you as when they are shooting at you.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: The public has a taste for supping with the great.
author: Ulick O'Connor

quote: Laughter would be bereaved if snobbery died.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: The true definition of a snob is one who craves for what separates men rather than for what unites them.
author: John Buchan

quote: No place in England where everyone can go is considered respectable.
author: George Moore

quote: Snobs talk as if they had begotten their ancestors.
author: Herbert Agar

quote: A highbrow is a person educated beyond his intelligence.
author: Brander Matthews

quote: All the people like us are We  And everyone else is They.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: The true snob never rests  there is always a higher goal to attain  and there are  by the same token  always more and more people to look down upon.
author: Russell Lynes

quote: Year of snow Fruit will grow.
author: Old English Rhyme

quote: But where are the snows of yesteryear?
author: Francois Villon

quote: These monstrous views ... these venomous teachings.
author: Pope Leo XIII

quote: All Socialism involves slavery.
author: Herbert Spencer

quote: Every generation is a secret society and has incommunicable enthusiasm  tastes and interests which are a mystery both to its predecessor and to posterity.
author: Arthur Chapman

quote: Fools take to themselves the respect that is given to their office. Aesop It is time in the West to defend not so much human rights as human obligations.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: Socialism must come down from the brain and reach the heart.
author: Jules Renard

quote: Society can only exist on the basis that there is some amount of polished lying and that no one says exactly what he thinks.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: The cocktail party - as the name itself indicates - was originally invented by dogs. They are simply bottom-sniffings raised to the rank of formal ceremonies.
author: Laurence Durrell

quote: Two people can form a community by excluding a third.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: The world has narrowed to a neighbourhood before it has broadened to a brotherhood.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: There are only two families in the world  as a Grandmother of mine used to say  the haves and the have-nots.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: What is a Communist? One who hath yearnings for equal division of unequal earnings.
author: Ebenezer Elliott

quote: Society is composed of two great classes: those who have more dinners than appetite  and those who have more appetite than dinners.
author: Sebastien Chamfort

quote: The complacent  the self-indulgent  the soft societies are about to be swept away with the debris of history.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Society is now one polished horde  Formed of two mighty tribes  The Bores and the Bored.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Society  dead or alive  can have no charm without intimacy and no intimacy without an interest in trifles.
author: Arthur Balfour

quote: To be social is to be forgiving.
author: Robert Frost

quote: If a free society cannot help the many who are poor  it cannot save the few who are rich.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The difference between our decadence and the Russians' is that while theirs is brutal  ours is apathetic.
author: James Thurber

quote: The cocktail party - a device for paying off obligations to people you don't want to invite to dinner.
author: Charles Merrill Smith

quote: Vigorous societies harbour a certain extravagance of objectives.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: In any assembly the simplest way to stop the transacting of business and split the ranks is to appeal to a principle.
author: Jacques Barzun

quote: Tolerably early in life I discovered that one of the unpardonable sins  in the eyes of most people  is for a man to go about unlabeled. The world regards such a person as the police do an unmuzzled dog.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: Etiquette means behaving yourself a little better than is absolutely essential.
author: Will Cuppy

quote: The best things and best people rise out of their separateness  I'm against a homogenized society because I want the cream to rise.
author: Robert Frost

quote: There are four varieties in society  the lovers  the ambitious  observers  and fools. The fools are the happiest.
author: Hippolyte Taine

quote: Whatever people may say  the fastidious formal manner of the upper classes is preferable to the slovenly easygoing behaviour of the common middle class. In moments of crisis  the former know how to act  the latter become uncouth brutes.
author: Cesare Pavese

quote: The classes that wash most are those that work least.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Necessity is the constant scourge of the lower classes  ennui of the higher ones.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Society  my dear  is like salt water  good to swim in but hard to swallow.
author: Arthur Stringer

quote: Only a few human beings should grow to the square mile  they are commonly planted too close.
author: William T. Davis

quote: Tis the final conflict! Let each stand in his place! The international working class shall be the human race!
author: The Internationale

quote: Every society honours its live conformists and its dead troublemakers.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: In order to stand well in the eyes of the community  it is necessary to come up to a certain  somewhat indefinite  conventional standard of wealth.
author: Thorstein Veblen

quote: Class is an aura of confidence that is being sure without being cocky. Class has nothing to do with money. Class never runs scared. It is self-discipline and self-knowledge. It's the sure-footedness that comes with having proved you can meet life.
author: Ann Landers

quote: I respect kindness in human beings first of all  and kindness to animals. I don't respect the law  I have a total irreverance for anything connected with society except that which makes the roads safer  the beer stronger  the food cheaper and the old men and old women warmer in the winter and happier in the summer.
author: Brendan Behan

quote: These families  you know  are our upper crust  not upper ten thousand.
author: James Fenimore Cooper

quote: He might have proved a useful adjunct  if not an ornament to society.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Man is a social animal.
author: Seneca

quote: It is impossible  in our condition of Society  not to be sometimes a Snob.
author: William Thackeray

quote: Home they brought her warrior dead.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: How sleep the brave  who sink to rest. By all their country's wishes blest!
author: William Collins

quote: We are coming  Father Abraham  three hundred thousand more.
author: J. S. Gibbons

quote: Every citizen should be a soldier. This was the case with the Greeks and Romans  and must be that of every free state.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: For it's Tommy this an' Tommy that  and "Chuck 'im out  the brute." But it's "Savior of 'is country " when the guns begin to shoot.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: It is not the guns or armament Or the money they can pay  It's the close co-operation That makes them win the day. It is not the individual Or the army as a whole  But the everlastin' teamwork Of every bloomin' soul.
author: J. Mason Knox

quote: But in a larger sense we cannot dedicate  we cannot consecrate  we cannot hallow this ground. The brave men  living and dead  who struggled here  have consecrated it far above our poor power to add or detract.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The muffled drum's sad roll has beat The soldier's last tattoo  No more on Life's parade shall meet The brave and fallen few. On Fame's eternal camping-ground Their silent tents are spread  And Glory guards  with solemn round The bivouac of the dead.
author: Theodore O'Hara

quote: I want to see you shoot the way you shout.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: There are three things a man must do alone. Be born  die  and testify.
author: James J. Walker

quote: Solitary trees  if they grow at all  grow strong.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: I was never less alone than when by myself.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: In the world a man lives in his own age  in solitude in all ages.
author: W. Matthews

quote: If from Society we learn to live Tis Solitude should teach us how to die  It hath no flatterers.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Solitude is as needful to the imagination as society is wholesome for the character.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: One can acquire everything in solitude but character.
author: Stendhal

quote: Solitude is the profoundest fact of the human condition. Man is the only being who knows he is alone.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: It's a rather pleasant experience to be alone in a bank at night.
author: Willie Sutton

quote: We're all of us sentenced to solitary confinement inside our own skins  for life.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: To dare to live alone is the rarest courage  since there are many who had rather meet their bitterest enemy in the field  than their own hearts in their closet.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: One of the greatest necessities in America is to discover creative solitude.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Secret  and self-contained  and solitary as an oyster.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Night  when words fade and things come alive  when the destructive analysis of day is done  and all that is truly important becomes whole and sound again. When man reassembles his fragmentary self and grows with the calm of a tree.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: In solitude  when we are least alone.
author: Lord Byron

quote: We enter the world alone  we leave it alone.
author: James Froude

quote: Far from the madding crowd's ignoble strife.
author: Thomas Gray

quote: Alone  alone  all  all alone  Alone on a wide  wide sea.
author: Hartley Coleridge

quote: I praise the Frenchman  his remark was shrewd  -  "How sweet  how passing sweet is solitude." But grant me still a friend in my retreat  Whom I may whisper - Solitude is sweet.
author: William Cowper

quote: The strongest man is the one who stands most alone.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: Solitude is as needful to the imagination as society is wholesome for the character.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: The thoughtful Soul to Solitude retires.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: Swans sing before they die - 'twere no bad thing Should certain persons die before they sing.
author: Hartley Coleridge

quote: A song will outlive all sermons in the memory.
author: Henry Giles

quote: And so make life  death and that vast forever One grand  sweet song.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: God sent his Singers upon earth With songs of sadness and of mirth  That they might touch the hearts of men  And bring them back to heaven again.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Our sweetest songs are those that tell of saddest thought.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: About suffering they were never wrong  The Old Masters  How well they understood Its human position  how it takes place While someone else is eating or opening a window or just walking dully along.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Excessive sorrow laughs. Excessive joy weeps.
author: William Blake

quote: He's simply got the instinct for being unhappy highly developed.
author: Saki

quote: One cannot weep for the entire world. It is beyond human strength. One must choose.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: Should you shield the canyons from the windstorms you would never see the true beauty of their carvings.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: Unhurt people are not much good in the world.
author: Enid Starkie

quote: In extreme youth  in our most humiliating sorrow  we think we are alone. When we are older we find that others have suffered too.
author: Suzanne Moarny

quote: The deeper the sorrow the less tongue it hath.
author: The Talmud

quote: Men who are unhappy  like men who sleep badly  are always proud of the fact.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: What man is there that does not laboriously  though all unconsciously  himself fashion the sorrow that is to be the pivot of his life.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: Only one-fourth of the sorrow in each man's life is caused by outside uncontrollable elements  the rest is self-imposed by failing to analyze and act with calmness.
author: George Jackson

quote: There is something pleasurable in calm remembrance of a past sorrow.
author: Cicero

quote: No one can keep his griefs in their prime  they use themselves up.
author: E. M. Cioran

quote: Sorrow is a fruit  God does not allow it to grow on a branch that is too weak to bear it.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: There are few sorrows  however poignant  in which a good income is of no avail.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: The busy have no time for tears.
author: Lord Byron

quote: I walked a mile with Sorrow And ne'er a word said she  But  oh  the things I learned from her When Sorrow walked with me.
author: Robert Browning Hamilton

quote: Every noble crown is  and on earth will ever be  a crown of thorns.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: All sorrows are bearable  if there is bread.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Hang sorrow  care'll kill a cat.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: To Sorrow I bade good-morrow  And thought to leave her far away behind  But cheerly  cheerly  She loves me dearly: She is so constant to me  and so kind.
author: John Keats

quote: Sorrows are like thunderclouds - in the distance they look black  over our heads scarcely gray.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: The deeper the sorrow  the less tongue hath it.
author: Talmud

quote: Joy was a flame in me Too steady to destroy. Lithe as a bending reed  Loving the storm that sways her -  I found more joy in sorrow Than you could find in joy.
author: Sara Teasdale

quote: There can be no rainbow without a cloud and a storm.
author: J. H. Vincent

quote: John Brown's body lies a mould'ring in the grave  His soul goes marching on.
author: Thomas Brigham Bishop

quote: It matters not how strait the gate  How charged with punishments the scroll  I am the master of my fate: I am the captain of my soul.
author: W. E. Henley

quote: Out of the night that covers me  Black as the Pit from pole to pole  I thank whatever gods may be For my unconquerable soul.
author: W. E. Henley

quote: What is a man profited  if he shall gain the whole world  and lose his own soul?
author: Matthew

quote: I sent my Soul through the Invisible  Some letter of that After-life to spell  And by and by my Soul returned to me  And answered "I Myself am Heav'n and Hell."
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: Self is the only prison that can ever bind the soul.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: A charge to keep I have  A God to glorify: A never-dying soul to save  And fit it for the sky.
author: Charles Wesley

quote: I loafe and invite my soul  I lean and loafe at my ease  observing a spear of summer grass.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The windows of my soul I throw Wide open to the sun.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: Hark! from the tombs a doleful sound.
author: Isaac Watts

quote: A man does not know what he is saying until he knows what he is not saying.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: He rose without a friend  and sat down without an enemy.
author: Henry Grattan

quote: Language most shows a man: speak  that I may see thee.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: Little said is soon amended. There is always time to add a word  never to withdraw one.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: None love to speak so much  when the mood of speaking comes  as they who are naturally taciturn.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Nothing is so unbelievable that oratory cannot make it acceptable.
author: Cicero

quote: Speak clearly  if you speak at all  Carve every word before you let it fall.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: The relationship of the toastmaster to the speaker should be the same as that of the fan to the fan dancer. It should call attention to the subject without making any particular effort to cover it.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: Though old the thought and oft exprest  'tis his at last who says it best.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: To know how to say what others only know how to think is what makes men poets or sages  and to dare to say what others only dare to think makes men martyrs or reformers or both.
author: Elizabeth Charles

quote: Whatever is well said by another  is mine.
author: Seneca

quote: Winston [Churchill] has devoted the best years of his life to preparing his impromptu speeches.
author: F. E. Smith

quote: Would you persuade  speak of interest  not of reason.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: It is terrible to speak well and be wrong.
author: Sophocles

quote: A dull speaker  like a plain woman  is credited with all the virtues  for we charitably suppose that a surface so unattractive must be compensated by interior blessings.
author: A. P. Herbert

quote: Once you get people laughing  they're listening and you can tell them almost anything.
author: Herbert Gardner

quote: When a man gets talking about himself  he seldom fails to be eloquent and often reaches the sublime.
author: Josh Billings

quote: In an easy cause any man may be eloquent.
author: Ovid

quote: The object of oratory alone is not truth  but persuasion.
author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

quote: If no thought your mind does visit make your speech not too explicit.
author: Piet Hein

quote: Oratory: the art of making deep noises from the chest sound like important messages from the brain.
author: H. I. Phillips

quote: The glittering generalities of the speaker have left an impression more delightful than permanent.
author: Franklin J. Dickman

quote: Say what you have to say and the first time you come to a sentence with a grammatical ending - sit down.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: First learn the meaning of what you say  and then speak.
author: Epictetus

quote: When a man is asked to make a speech  the first thing he has to decide is what to say.
author: Gerald Ford

quote: I've never thought my speeches were too long  I've rather enjoyed them.
author: Hubert Humphrey

quote: Blessed is the man who  having nothing to say  abstains from giving us wordy evidence of the fact.
author: George Eliot
